8am to 5pm, M-F.

When you find 1st Street, turn towards the lake.  Go down the hill and you will see a tall office building.  It is on the first floor of this building.

comment: Hello. We are in process of renovating a gorgeous 1920 building into an Art Lounge here in St. Petersburg and our plan is to create a single 'bathroom' where every stall has a toilet which is enclosed in it's own small room. Complete privacy for everyone.  Then everyone shares the 4 sinks and "primping" area.  This will be a classy modern art gallery mashed together with a swanky lounge. I've seen this type of bath setup all over Europe and am going to use it here.  But the city is giving me a headache about it.  Can you please offer any advice or comments to help us along?  Much thanks and good luck to us all!  Michael  :-)lrn2thnk@tampabay.rr.com

comment: Open 5pm-2am; if you were to stop in Plattsburgh at least once in your life, the Monopole is pretty much THE bar you would want to hang out at. Very chill atmosphere; dudes and girls share the same bathroom and everyone's cool with that. Though some people in the North Country are incredulous at the thought: "OMG I can't believe this is a shared bathroom!" But they get over it.
name: Monopole
directions: Two unisex bathrooms; one on the first level, one upstairs

Staff is mostly gay friendly, patrons are so-so, but I have never had trouble.

comment: This is the family-use bathroom in the Boulder Public Library Children's Room, and generally used for caregivers and small children. For children's safety they require that people ask for the key, but as of May 29, 2007 the head Children's Librarian has instructed her staff that the key is to be provided to anyone who asks to use "the safe2pee bathroom." You can also simply say you are transgendered and uncomfortable using the other public bathrooms and they will provide the key.

The building has a few bathrooms, some gender specific, and at least one that is either 'family' or just not designated.

The staff and volunteers are all friendly and will never judge you; the volunteers are expected not to talk about anyone they work with or for.

directions:
The first door immediately down the hall at the Seneca Building, just past the front desk, ground floor.

Mapquest will lose you; come up to it from Madison and the large signs will be more of a clue.  It is the less obvious of the two Lifelong buildings on either side of the Copy Mart.

I've never had an issue with the bathroom though.  The bathroom is closer to the entrance than where most of the employees stand, so you might be able to sneak in without paying, but it's difficult.

comment: __Locking the door:__ It may not be immediately clear, but the door to this bathroom *does* lock. It does not have a physical latch, but in the corner across from the toilet (diagonal from the sink) there are two buttons at about three feet above the floor. One locks the door and the other unlocks and automatically opens the door. ------- __Accessibility button by the door:__ This button to automatically open the door does not work. The buttons in the corner described above function fine. ------- __Hours:__ GSU is open late - especially this building, which tends to host a lot of astronomy labs. This building will probably be locked very late at night and very early in the morning, and may have somewhat more limited hours during the summer. ------- __More info about this building:__ The official university webpage for Kell Hall is at  http://www.gsu.edu/site2005/29529.html  or  tinyurl.com/gsukell . ------- __User-Safety:__ Our school is very racially diverse, so campus security is not likely to harass users of this bathroom who are not GSU students *solely* on the basis of their ethnicity, but the police at GSU and in downtown Atlanta in general have been 'cracking down on homelessness' (i.e., perpetuating racism and classism like it'll fix the economic and structural problems in the city), so you may get flack or worse if you 'look' very poor, especially if you are older than traditional college student age and not white.
name: Georgia State University - Kell Hall
directions: This is on the first floor of Kell Hall, near the Peachtree Center Ave entrance, just before the elevators. ------- As of July 2011, if you enter the building from the Peachtree Center Ave entrance, there will be a large open space eventually connecting to Sparks Hall in front of you; a very large sign for and small hallway to the Cooperative Learning Lab to your right; and a short hallway leading to the elevators to your left. ------- Turn left and walk a few yards - there will be a small alcove with a women's restroom and this single-occupancy, accessible, non-gender-specific bathroom.

comment:
The bathroom here is always sooo bad you can not believe it. The stench of stale human urine is detectable when approaching this  festering hellhole. I worked in the Sewage and Wastewater industry for years, yet this bathroom was still nearly too much for me.

Think they just forgot to clean this week.. no way! It\'s been like this since I first had to use it in 2006

They must have a separate restroom for the employees because it is an F-ing horror-show in there.

Restrooms are hypothetically ADA compliant, but the hallway leading to them is a tight fit and the bathrooms are small, so it might be easier to go elsewhere downtown

comment:
It\'s not imperative that you buy anything; plenty of people wander in and out without doing so.  But it\'s a small business, and it\'s queer friendly, so please do!



I\'ve used both male and female restrooms without question or interference; a sizeable number of customers are gay/trans, and the owner and manager are both pretty open and supportive.

comment: While I\'m not confident that the business, itself, is particularly trans-friendly, I\'ve eaten there and used both restrooms without any hostile interactions (or even funny looks), as have several pre-transition transwomen and transmen, and gender non-conforming gay folks I\'m friends with.

Open during most holidays!



Dine in. Lunch & Dinner Buffet. Take Out. Delivery.



Telephone: (508) 285-8828

www.greatwoodsmandarin.com
name: Mandarin

comment: There's not a lot around there, but if you happen to have an appt. or be in the neighborhood (or are passing by on the 9, 17, 35, 36, 38, 45, 54, 55, 56 and 92 buses). Closed Sundays. Open M, T, Th 8am - 7:30pm, Wed 12-7:30pm, Fri 9-4:30pm, Sat 9am-12:30pm. More info http://www.ncnm.edu/ncnm-teaching-clinic/ncnm-clinic.php
name: NCNM Natural Health Center
directions: It's inside the front doors (past the entryway), just passed the patient seating area.  The bathroom is on the right side of the hall directly after the patient seating area.

comment: I think the hours are from 5 am to 9 pm
name: Peet\'s Coffee
directions: back of store

comment: Considerably cleaner than the regular public restrooms.
name: Nokomis Village Publix
directions: Right next to the drink machine by the deli counter.

comment: It\'s marked as a \"family\" restroom, but I don\'t see how this really matters.
name: Monroeville Mall
directions: The top floor on the side where the Mr. Roger\'s Neighborhood playground is. There may be more in the other bathroom areas as well.

name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
directions: In the back on the left

comment: Open 24 hours. You have to ask one of the baristas for the door code.
name: Starbucks
directions: On the far left, past the counter.

comment: E. Moore Hall is the columned, red-brick building that sits across (and to the left) from the MountainLair on WVU\'s downtown campus. You don\'t have to be a student to use the bathroom.
name: Elizabeth Moore Hall
directions: Go in the door and take the first hallway to the right. Go around the corner to the right, and you\'ll see a door that\'s usually standing open. There\'s a sign that identifies this bathroom as being for both sexes, and an outer door that locks. There\'s one stall inside that also locks.

comment: 24 hours, usually a busy place so you can go unnoticed, crowd is very diverse.
name: Hard Rock Hotel, Las Vegas
directions: From the parking garage, enter through the main corridor into the casino.  A large set of public restrooms will be on the left side before you actually set foot into the casino.

comment: Closed Sundays during the summer
name: Boulder City Public Library
directions: Walk past the circulation desk and make a right.  The bathrooms are in the back on the right.

comment: 8am to 11pm most days
name: Greenleaf Mary Hobbs Basement
directions: Take a right as soon as you go in the back door it should be right on your left

comment: I work in the airport, I started presenting as female full-time in June.  Last week someone registered a complaint about me using ladies washrooms, and I was asked to stop.  I presented my carry letter and a letter from an advocate to my head office and the airport authority, and the response was that I can now use the washrooms I feel most comfortable using.
name: Calgary International Airport
directions: There are two main sections of shops in the Airport, these single-unit bathrooms are in the area near Gate D (WestJet).  Go the the third floor (mezanine level), and follow the directions to the conference rooms Kitty Hawk and Silver Dart.  The stalls are in an area overlooking the second-floor Starbucks and Kelsey\'s.

comment: I work in the airport, I started presenting as female full-time in June.  Last week someone registered a complaint about me using ladies washrooms, and I was asked to stop.  I presented my carry letter and a letter from an advocate to my head office and the airport authority, and the response was that I can now use the washrooms I feel most comfortable using.  The reason I mention this is that, if you\'re confident that you\'re presenting well, you may not need to use these \"special\" washrooms.
name: Calgary International Airport
directions: There are several locking washrooms throughout the airport which are designated as handicapped and \"family\" washrooms.

name: AVP
directions: Second Floor

name: AVP
directions: Second Floor

comment: This is quite a nice facility... every time I have been in there, it has been clean. It is also easily accessible and there usually aren\'t a whole lot of people about. There are enough to be safe, because lots of people study near Fieras, but nobody will be judging you for using the bathroom.
name: NMU Learning Resources Center
directions: Enter the doors underneath the great big window of the Olson Library... you should immediately see a set of stairs leading to the WNMU facilities. If you don\'t see these, and you entered from up on campus, then you need to go downstairs, then past Starbucks toward the WNMU stairs. The bathroom is across from the television facilities, which are right near the doors.

comment:
open dawn-dusk



You might not want to go there alone after dusk, as it is a common youth hangout. I used to frequent that area at night and know how unsavory it can be if things go south.
name: Quentin Park
directions: In the summer, there is almost always a portapotty set up in this park. Yes, it\'s a little gross to use a portapotty, but it\'ll do in a pinch. It\'s set up on the tarmac path near the baseball fields, not too far from the playground equipment/tennis courts... right near the water fountain.

comment:
The people at Woldumar are extremely friendly, and this is an excellent place to go even if you don\'t have to pee.



The only thing I would caution against is going when their annual summer camp is on, and that\'s only because the basement area with the fish can get quite crowded with children, so it\'d be hard to get through unnoticed.
name: Woldumar Nature Center

comment: This is an excellent library anyway, so stop in for more than a pee if you can.
name: Clarence H Rosa Public Library

comment: About 2/3\'s are gender neutral, and all are accessible.
name: Willamette Falls Hospital
directions: Several public bathrooms throughout compound.

comment: About 2/3\'s are gender neutral, and all are accessible.
name: Willamette Falls Hospital
directions: Several public bathrooms throughout compound.

name: Danbury Fair Mall Food Court
directions: When facing the carrousel, go to the corridor on the left. Family style bathrooms are on the left.

comment: Just in the off chance that you\'re at the seminary and need to pee.
name: Luther Seminary
directions: It\'s on the lowest floor of the building, by the entrance to the auditorium.

name: Porter Square T Station
directions: On the mezzanine, right after you pass through the gates, turn left instead of going down the second set of stairs/escatator and you\'ll see the gender-neutral bathroom sign!

comment: If you don\'t want to be conspicuous just stroll into Urbana, their restaurant/bar and head towards the lobby, bathroom\'s on your right. Otherwise just walk into the lobby like you own the place and head straight for the loo
name: The Hotel Palomar
directions: Lobby to the right of the main counter. Enter hotel through the front doors to your right.

comment: 2 single stall gender neutral lockable and accessible public restrooms (spacious)
name: Belk Library-ASU
directions: 4th floor, on circle it is near the elevators.  If you take the elevators, take a left.

comment: Infused house vodka. Happy hour prices all day Tuesdays. Gay-owned!
name: Crush Bar
directions: Go in main entrance; it\'s to the right around the corner. Three locked stalls with a common room that has sinks and mirrors.

comment:
http://www.msmarket.coop/



Open Daily 8:30am-9:30pm
name: Mississippi Market Natural Foods Co-op
directions: Restrooms are located by cash registers.

name: Roxie Theater
directions: In the lobby

comment:
Two single-occupancy genderfree bathrooms, one accessible.



You need to show NYU ID, but you can probably just flash any purple card with a picture as you walk by, the guards never look very closely.  You may be able to just ask nicely as well.



Sometimes the emergency exit on the west side towards the south is open, in which case you can enter there without ID.
name: Warren Weaver Hall
directions: first floor, south end.

comment: Door is open until the library closes. I think around 10pm on weekdays. You can check the u of t library site for hours of operation.
name: New College, University of Toronto
directions: Go in the entrance as though you wanted to go to the Ivey Library. It\'s just off to your right.

comment: Decent Italian restaurant chain, this one\'s in the gay village.
name: Il Fornello
directions: Toward the back of the restaurant, on the right wall.

comment: Again, act like a college student and don\'t mess around or campus security might be on you. Pee and leave.
name: Whittier College - Mendenhall
directions: Business hours only. Mendenhall is on the SW side of the Painter/Philadelphia intersection. You can walk through a little path on the right if you are walking north on Painter towards the intersection. Go in the door and look to the right. The College doesn\'t need iD to get on campus, but be mindful - building locked during the evening.

comment: Key required, which may be freely borrowed from the Book Return Desk on the other side of the stairs. You don\'t need to ask staff to borrow the key. Keys and doors are labeled in blue and pink. \"Women\'s\" has a changing shelf, \"men\'s\" has a urinal. Open during library hours.
name: Centralia Timberland Library
directions: To the left of the Silver Street door, behind the stairs.

comment: Every other toilet on campus is essentially genderfree - nobody will give a crap which one you use.  And there are always tourists/random people on campus, so nobody will ever look at you strangely.
name: College of the Atlantic - turrets great hall
directions: This bathroom is in turrets great hall, on the first floor.  Go in the mail door, immediatly go left, and there are two single occupancy bathrooms with no gender signs.

name: Starr King School for the Ministry
directions: Down the stairs to the left.  If you need wheel chari access, it\'s down the driveway to the right of the school and in through the back door.  It is against the far wall to the right.

comment:
- because this is a bar/night club there may be cover some nights, but once you\'re in it\'s all free.

- andy\'s has done a great job of renovating their bathroom\'s into possibly one of the best gender neutral places to pee out there.
name: Andy Poolhall
directions: once you enter the smaller half of the bar turn left, go through the door way to the second half. the bathrooms are along the right hand wall on the far side of the bar.

comment: Hours-9-5 Monday-Friday
name: UMass Stonewall Center
directions: This is part of the Queer resource center on campus.  Single bathroom labeled gender neutral.  Not accessible due to stairs to get into the center.

name: Starbucks
directions: On the left, past the bar

comment: Just waltz right in. No key needed.
name: Goodwill Super Store
directions: Back of store.

comment: Bring your own toilet paper, or napkins!
name: Coin-Op Laundry
directions: Back of laundry mat.

comment: open as long as the mall is open.  happy shopping!
name: Chesterfield Town Center
directions: Walk in the food court entrance and to the right, there is a hallway next to Red Robin.  Straight ahead are the \'family\' bathrooms.  Men and women walk in with and without children.  There are several large stalls.  There are also separate mens and womens restrooms to the right of the family bathrooms.

comment: The library is open Monday to Friday 8:20 am to 10:45 pm, Saturdays 10 am to 7:45 pm, and Sundays 1 pm to 10:45 pm during the fall and winter semesters.  May to August, the library is open only on weekdays, 8:30 to 4:00.
name: R. P. Bell Library (Mount Allison University)
directions: This washroom is on the main floor of the library on the left side of the building.

comment: Also, a sharps container in there. On the go T shot?
name: Fashion Valley Mall
directions: In food court, across from theatre. Is a single stall family restroom.

comment: closes at 8pm
name: Boston GLASS
directions: Get off at Hynes ICA station and directly cross the street DO NOT Walk over the Bridge (it takes you to Fenway community health clinic) Glass is right next to the matress store!

name: BAGLY Boston
directions: Its directly across from the Copley Fountain. Different meetings are held on Wednesdays 6-9pm (pee then join the meeting!)

comment: Buildings on campus generally lock automatically after 9p and are variably open on the weekends. Sometimes this bathroom gets locked, you can pick up a phone in the hallway that\'s on-campus only and report it anonymously to facilities & maintenance
name: Portland State University, Urban Center
directions: 2nd Floor, around corner to the right after exiting stairwell or elevator

comment: Might be seasonally locked by Parks Department
name: Waterfont Park Under Hawthorne Bridge
directions: Underneath Hawthorne Bridge on the west side of Willamette River

comment: 24 Hours a day/7 days a week.
name: University BP
directions: Just walk in and it\'s to the left of the counter. I\'ve walked in during one of my late night walks and they didn\'t have any problems with me just walking in.

name: The Mirage
directions: look for the companion restroom in the hallway leading to the Terry Fator Theatre (formerly known as the Danny Gans Theater)

name: Aliante Station
directions: located near the mrkt restaurant

name: Bealls Outlet
directions: The bathroom is at the back of the store and accomodates several users at a time regardless of gender.

name: NMU C.B. Hedgecock Building
directions: The bathroom is on the ground floor, near the center of the building where the student services center is. If you see admissions, disability services, or the registrar\'s office you are very close.

comment: Really good coffee and breakfast.  Open 6am-8pm Mon.-Sat. and 6-6 on Sundays.  Staff/service is funky and fun.
name: Sunnyside Up Cafe
directions: To the far left of the room to the left of the coffee counter, down the hall in the back corner next to the play area

comment: Open 24 hours a day, every day
name: Lusty Lady Theatre
directions: In the back, look for the swinging doors

comment: Two rooms-- each spacious with a toilet, a sink, a diaper changing station, and a locking door.  One has a male sign outside and one has a female sign, but in practice people just use whichever is open.
name: Berkshire Co-op Market
directions: In the back right corner of the store from the entrance--past the bulk bins.

comment: If you ask nicely they will most likely let you use the bathroom without a purchase.
name: Kitchen Sink
directions: Back of cafe on left.

comment: As for actually eating there, the coffee is adequate, though one wishes they would spring for actual cups instead of styrofoam. The food is OK, if not a bit pricey. They have relaxing chairs on one side, but I wish they had installed tables other than closed-off booths.
name: Zanzibar
directions: All on one floor. There are, in fact, two gender neutral bathrooms. The signs on each door indicate either one is for men and/or women.

name: Pacific College of Oriental Medicine
directions: walk up the stairs, take a right down the clinic hallway, take another right and there are two bathrooms, a men\'s room and another lockable single stall room.  Since this is a school and a public health clinic, you should have little to no trouble.  Unfortunately it is on the second floor so, accessibility is complicated.

comment: Bathrooms are roomy and single toilet. Accessibility is great--there is plenty of room to maneuver me, my power wheelchair and my attendant. Bonus: there\'s almost always no waiting!
name: Conseco Fieldhouse
directions: Family/Unisex restrooms are on each seating level (near sections 3, 103, and 203) and near the corners of the building on the Founders level.

comment: Open while the mall is open. There is probably still a bit of taboo with using these if you don\'t have kids in tow (they have a neat kid-friendly toilet too) but I had no problems even when I came out to find a huge family waiting.
name: Washington Square Mall
directions: Look for \'family bathrooms\' -- one is located by JCPenny, and there is one other I believe. Food court bathrooms are NOT genderfree.

name: Quimby\'s Books
directions: Ask at the store counter to use the restroom. It\'s in the basement. They\'ll direct you there.

comment: They are open until 11pm!
name: The Gelateria
directions: Inside shop, toward the back of the shop. This place is great on accessibility.

name: Crown Candy Kitchen
directions: Back of the restaurant, through a door. You should probably buy something, but they wouldn\\\'t hold you to it.

name: Atomic Cowboy
directions: There are separate men\'s and women\'s single-seaters, but in the back near the door to the quonset hut (and near the ATM) there is a genderfree bathroom.

name: Riley\'s Pub
directions: There are separate men\'s and women\'s single-seaters in the main room, but in the side room (off to the left when you come in) there is a genderfree bathroom.

comment: Hours are at http://libraries.slu.edu/about/hours/libhours.html
name: Pius Library, St. Louis University
directions: The genderfree, accessible bathrooms are in the basement. They are right at the bottom of the big staircase. There are 2 single seaters.

comment: You just need to ask for the key at the front counter. There are no questions asked and you do not have to buy anything.
name: MAXX Adult Emporium

comment: New School ID required for entry.
name: New SchoolUniversity
directions: 1st floor across from elevators.  Single stall bathroom.  Any gender may access.

comment: http://www.609u.com/
name: 609 Lounge/Restaurant
directions: all toilet rooms are unisex, both in the restaurant and the bar.

name: Hi-Pointe Theatre
directions: Ground floor, off to the left as you come in.  The bathroom is supposed to be reserved for elderly and disabled (the men/women bathrooms are at the top of a VERY steep staircase), but in my experience (as both patron and former employee), the employees will rarely raise a stink if you use it and you don\'t fall into those categories.  One standard toilet and sink.

comment: Hours are Mon-Fri 9-5 and Sat 10-1
name: Alternatives Federal Credit Union
directions: On lower level of the building

comment: 10am-10pm, M-Sat, 11am-6pm, Sun. This is a GLBT-friendly independent full-service bookseller. You can also bring your dog.
name: Left Bank Books
directions: In the back of the bookstore, by the magazines. You have to ask for the key from the bookseller at the check-out counter.

name: Hills Memorial Library Children\'s Room
directions: The ground floor. Back entrances take you strait into the Children\'s Room. Front entrance, go down the stairs to your left.

name: Crazy Bowls and Wraps
directions: They are in the back of the place, at the end of the hall that is to your right hand side as you come in the door. Two separate single-seaters.

comment: http://www.crowncandykitchen.net/
name: Crown Candy Kitchen
directions: In a hall off the back of the restaurant. Ask and they will direct you.

comment: Monday - Friday 7AM to 8PMish
name: University of New Mexico Ortega Hall First Floor SE Entrance
directions: Ortega Hall, 1st Floor Southeast Entrance in Long Winding Hallway.

name: Modesto, CA / Deva Cafe
directions: Through the front door, head all the way to the counter as if you\'re going to order.  Enter the small hallway to the left of the counter, take a right down the hall to the two unisex bathrooms.

name: Kopi Cafe
directions: straight to the back, to the left of the boutique.

comment: during library hours
name: public health library
directions: not flirt- but kindly ask the person at the circulation desk for the restroom key.

comment: Accessibility in the campus library is complicated (enter via the basement past non-accessible gender-neutral bathrooms, through a locked door to the elevator) and the first floor bathroom is explicitly for female-identified people. All others are are gender neutral.
name: Hampshire College
directions: Just about all of the bathrooms throughout Hampshire Campus are Gender-Neutral (some specify \"with urinals\" or \"with sanitary bins\").  Many, however, are not labeled as bathrooms at all and can be hard to find, but ask any student for the nearest bathroom and you\'re good.

comment: No changing tables, generally kept clean.
name: Bar Ferdinand
directions: One on main floor, two in basement level

comment: Have observed many men using women\'s room in a pinch, so probably no one will care either way.
name: The Abbaye
directions: One of each gender single toilet, locking.

comment: http://www.rollapubliclibrary.org
name: Rolla Public Library
directions: It\'s on the first floor. You must ask at the library desk for a key.

name: Buell Hall Eastern Michigan University
directions:
Rest rooms are available on all floors in the Dorm. 

All Public restrooms are genderfree and handicap accessible, But building hours are restricted. If you don\'t live there, go in, pee, go out. If you do...use the bath room in your dorm!

comment: Two bathrooms, both gender-free.  I believe the back door (closest to the bathrooms) has wheelchair access, so I am marking this one \"Accessible,\" but please call ahead to make sure of this.  The bathrooms are some of the cleanest and roomiest (and most nicely-decorated) I\'ve ever seen.  No smoking, awesome locally-grown food, trivia on Tuesday nights, great beer selection, cheap drinking options, et cetera.  http://www.newsteadtowerpub.com
name: Newstead Tower Public House
directions: Two bathrooms, through the restaurant main room, in the back corridor, by the back door.  If you just come in really quickly and go straight to \'em (or heck, even if you ask where they are), nobody is likely to stop you.  Then you can exit through the back if you feel the need to make a quick escape!

comment: http://mississippimudhouse.com/
name: Mississippi Mud House
directions: There are two genderfree single-seaters, one in each room of the cafe. One is in the back of the main room, and the other is sort of in the middle of the side room. It\'s not a very big place, so you should see them. It\'s a friendly joint!

name: Heath Museum and Confectionery
directions:
It\'s in back in an employees only area, so you have to ask at the counter of this tiny storefront museum and they will direct you. 



Admission to the museum is free.

comment: http://noodlecafe.awardspace.com/
name: China Noodle Cafe
directions: They are down the hallway in the back of the restaurant.

comment: http://www.tincantavern.com/
name: Tin Can Tavern
directions: Two locking binary gendered single seaters. They are on a little hallway off to the left as you walk in.

name: O\'Connell\'s Pub
directions:
In the second room back, on the right hand side, there are 2 single seater binary gendered bathrooms. In the women\'s room, make sure you close the lock all the way, because it likes to act like it\'s locked when it is not. 



Very friendly place, though.

comment:
http://www.theroyale.com/



They have a drink named after every ward in the city.
name: The Royale
directions: In the back, to the left hand side of the room. 2 single seater locking binary gendered bathrooms.

name: Regal Fox Tower Stadium 10
directions: down the hall from theatre number ten. to the right of the womens restroom.

comment: They have 2 family bathrooms that I usually use. Nice and clean and you don\'t get weird looks.
name: Alderwood Mall
directions: On the north side of the mall, right outside the second entrances by the starbucks.

comment: you should order a drink but if you pretend you know what you are doing they will think your just a regular customer
name: the third place
directions: just walk in go to the back the bathrooms are down the hallway on the right.  there are single stall locking doors and are usually very clean.

comment: support your local owned coffee shops and buy something or drop in a tip for the people who refill the paper.
name: Cup a Joe (Mission Valley)
directions: Just walk toward the back both are single stall with locking doors.

comment: Poor Richard\'s is pretty notable for being LGBT-friendly. I\'ve never had a problem here!
name: Poor Richard\'s Restaurant
directions: They\'re in the back of the restaurant, after you pass the counter where you order food, and the entrance to the toy store.

comment:
Both restrooms are locking singles.  We haven\'t gotten around to taking the gender markers off.

Please consider having a meal with us or at least a beverage and dessert. We are trans friendly employers and would like to stay in business during these hard times!

Open Wed 5 - 8 for Dinner, Thurs-Sat 11-8 for Lunch and Dinner.  If someone is there during our closed times, and it\'s an emergency, knock on the door and ask.
name: Cafe Sonoita
directions: left from entrance and straight back

comment: The Center is open from 9am-9pm. Ask at the Front Desk - the staff is trained to be transgender-friendly.
name: Long Island LGBT Center
directions: The LI LGBT Center has three non-gendered single stall locking bathrooms. One is accessible. An inaccessible and accessible bathroom are located on the left-hand side of the building in the multipurpose room. A third bathroom is located in the staff-only area on the right side.

comment: 11AM-11:30PM - just pretend you\'re meeting someone!
name: Galanga
directions: Bathroom is in basement. Walk to back of restraunt and down small flight of stairs. There are two non-gendered locking bathrooms.

comment: open during library hours
name: St. Michael\'s College
directions: Durrick Library @ St. Michael\'s College- main floor left past reference desk near water fountain

name: Pitfire Pizza
directions: Single-floor restaurant, simple lay-out. Single-stall restrooms are at the back, past the counters, on the right. Not sure if purchase is expected, but you don\'t need a key. Unsure about accessibility specifics, but appeared accessible.

name: Kiosko del Zocalo
directions: Interior Kiosko

name: Hoi Polloi
directions: In cafe to left of counter.

name: Mall at Robinson
directions: In the food court bathroom area.  \'Family room\' says only for people with kids, but I have walked in before.

name: Casco Bay Ferry Terminal
directions: first floor, off the main lobby

comment: very comfortable atmosphere
name: Colonial Inn
directions: inside main entrance past reservation desk

comment: mall crowds and schedules, can be busy
name: Burlington Mall

comment: On the first floor, there are single stall, handicap accesible bathrooms with signs that say \"men EXCLUSIVELY\" and \"women EXCLUSIVELY.\"  wtf?  Use them anyway.  Otherwise, on the other floors the bathrooms are gendered.
name: Chicago Theater
McMinnville Community Center
directions: Walk in front door, turn left, bathrooms on left down hall.

name: Wortman Park
directions: Park has entrances on Lafayette Ave. and McDaniel Lane. McDaniel side has parking adjacent to restrooms.

comment: Open 8am to 5pm.  The bathroom has a men sign and a women sign on it but one of the signs falls down frequently.  The stall doors don\'t work so lock the main door to the bathroom.
name: Allegheny County Health Department
directions: Walk in the back door of Building 1.  Take the elevator or the stairs to the third floor.  Turn right the top of the stairs.  The bathroom is on your right.

name: Chatham College

In the Falk section of Braun-Falk-Coolidge on the first floor.  There is also one in the basement.
Also: In the basement of the Mellon house, and
on the first floor of the Art & Design Center.

name: Target
directions: Just inside the front door on the right

name: Images Pittsburgh

name: Hartford Public Library
directions: It\'s a library! Easily accessible.

comment:
It\'s a cute queer-owned neighborhood cafe & breakfast favorite.  The bathrooms even have cute chalk boards if you want to leave a message.

Hours:

Monday-Saturday 7am-3pm

Sunday 8am-3pm



t 412.244.8002
name: Square Cafe

When you walk in, the to-go counter is on your left. Pass the counter, keep walking towards the back into the small hallway & the bathrooms are on your left.

name: Library, USF

comment: En las salidas de Liverpool, el Palacio de Hierro y en el area de alimentos
name: Angelopolis
directions: Planta Baja y Planta ALta

directions: Go to the rear of the store, about in the center of the back wall.  It may be called  \' site to store\'  thier is both gender bathrooms and a \'family\' bathroom.  the \'family\' bathroom is a single toilet, with a locking door.

comment:
(714) 901-3087

Advertises \"late night hours\"
name: KFC
directions: If you\'re facing the counter, the bathrooms are behind you on the right.

name: Whole Foods
directions:
The bathrooms are directly on your left as you enter from the parking lot entrance.

From the other entrance, continue past the check-out area towards the opposite entrance/exit.

comment: The entire restroom is gender neutral, each restroom has it\'s own locking door and sink, so nobody every questions your gender!  It is great!

comment:
The bathroom itself has a bathtub and shower that has been converted into a mural.



Indie coffee shop & music venue

714-525-5287

M-F 8:30am till 3am

Queer- & genderqueer- friendly arts studio where high school students and older artists make art and work on projects together. There is usually art hanging on the studio walls, gallery-style, so you can stand around looking at that if you want an excuse for being there!
name: New Urban Arts
directions: This is an after-school arts program; the population is mostly high school students, but anybody is welcome to come in.  Just ask if you can use the bathroom -- someone will direct you to it!  It\\\'s at the back left-hand corner of the space, behind the silkscreen washout sink.

Bathrooms investigated by genderWHAT?! and the LGBTQ Coalition at ASU: B+



It is well lit, clean, locking, and handicap accessible.  It did not receive an A because of the general shabbiness of the room itself, and because our experience has not always been so pleasant at this location.  Says one coalition member, the bathroom is still creepy, but now well lit.

1)RCH (JR Coutts Engineering Lecture Hall): basement / lower floor.  There\'s a single-stall wheelchair accessible washroom across from the water fountain & vending machines.

2) SLC: there are two gender-neutral accessible bathrooms on the main floor right beside Tim Hortons.

3) ENVIRONMENT 2: on the ground floor, down a side hallway where the research labs are. Unmarked door, single stall. Has a grab bar but it\\\'s a tiny space and the door is heavy.

comment:
It\'s pretty easy to get directions to the right building on campus- I suggest U-House if it\'s open. The Gym building is the one behind U-House- the door closest to U-House puts you in the right hallway.



Don\'t worry if someone stops to talk to you in U-House- the regulars are pretty queer friendly. If you see a short guy with green glasses and a pierced lip, it\'s probably me :)



There\'s a fee for parking on campus, though you can get around it by parking on McKenzie road- just watch the signage.
name: University of the Fraser Valley

comment: Public toilet but clean. closes at 7pm
name: Niles
directions: H & Niles intersection

name: Hamburger Haven

directions: Across from the front door, main room.

comment: A small queer cafe with odd hours
name: Coming Home Cafe
directions: There is a small hallway at the back of the cafe, the very last door on the left is the bathroom

comment: peeing at the seat of government is always nice.
name: City hall
directions: Straight ahead after walking in the front door

comment: It is a coffee and wine cafe. The bathrooms are single user. They know I am a CD and have always been friendly.
name: Cup & Cork

comment: It is a coffee shop and book store. There is one gender neutral bathroom. They know I am a CD and have always been friendly.
name: Broadway Books and Roasting Company
directions: You have to go up a staircase to get inside, so it is not wheelchair accessible.

comment: It is small coffee cafe. I have been there many times. I think they know I am a CD.
name: Crossroads Coffee Company

comment: It is a gay bar. Open W-Sun 9-?. They often have a cover for drag shows.  I\'ve only seen 1 gender neutral bathroom but others tell me that there are 2, 2 stalls no doors and 2 urinals, no doors to get in either.  Drag nights are 3$ cover.
name: Club Traz
Safeway
directions: There are gendered ones up front by starbucks, but if you go to the back and go through the back door by the eggs and turn left there is a one person genderfree bathroom.

comment: You don\'t usually have to buy something, but they\'ve got the best coffee in town anyways, so if you\'re stuck grab an americano. Very family friendly, queer-friendly, artist/student-friendly. free computer/internet access with purchase.
name: Exhibit Cafe
directions: Go in Cafe entrance, washrooms to the right. Single stall, accessible, locking, non-gendered washrooms.

comment: The Rainbow Centre is a queer service, it is welcoming of differently gendered/abled bodies. It is a resource centre, feel free to access the library and resources available. Hours posted on door.
name: Rainbow Centre
directions: In MacDonald House Residence, Swipe student card and continue down hallway to ahead/ to the left. The RC is on the left, when it is open the single use gender inclusive washroom is always available.

name: University of Windsor
directions: Dillon hall 252, Chysler hall south (multiple)

comment: I work at Peace Nook and it is the place I always run to if I need to use the bathroom. No one cares. You don\'t have to buy anything. We don\'t really care. Feel free to use our bathroom, and feel safe! We also have stand-while-you-pee devices for anyone interested :)
name: Peace Nook
directions: The store is downstairs, the door is located between the peace and rainbow flags. The bathroom is towards the back, but you can just ask an employee where the bathroom is.

name: Starbucks
directions: Starbucks at the Quinte Mall has 2 single bathrooms both marked for \"both\" genders.

name: Toby\'s Community Playground
street: Corner of Toby Street and Mesa Road
directions: Very difficult to miss - right in front of the platground.

comment: Single stall bathroom that\\\'s more like a whole restroom to yourself.  Outer door locks, inside both a urinal and toilet within a stall + sink.  Great for transguys learning to pee standing up and who want to practice at a real urinal.
name: University of Hawaii at Manoa
directions: Ka Leo building near Campus Center.

comment: This is a restauarant as well; one need not be 21 to enter. Single stall (room) for all genders designated handicapped access.

comment: This is an excellent family-owned health food/nutritional supplement store.  Has excellent vegetarian foods, cruelty-free foods, alternative health supplies, and resources for people with food allergies.
name: The Health Concern
directions: Go to the back right corner of the store and go into the rear stock area between two freezer cases.  Turn left, and there will be a sign indicating the bathroom on your right.

directions: near the rear of the building, on the left side

name: Scott Hall, Pitzer College
directions:
There are two nearly identical single stall locking bathrooms, one on 1st floor one on the second. Both are on the far south side of the building.



The bathroom on the first floor is marked as unisex, and accessible, though it does not meet ADA requirements. The door frame is too narrow (only 27') among other problems. There is elevator access to the east of the building, between the Broad and Bernard Hall.

comment: Building is open (at least) 9-5 M-F when school is in session.

directions: The bathroom is on the 2nd floor, on the east side of the building. It is gender neutral, single stall, and locking. Elevator access is outside of the building, to the east, between Bernard Hall and Broad Center.

comment: Building is open (at least) 9-5 M-F when school is in session.
name: Smith Campus Center, Pomona College
directions:
The bathroom is in the east wing of the basement, behind Doms lounge. It is marked unisex and accessible, single stall, and locking. It also seems to serve as a janitor's closet.



There is an elevator in the west end of the courtyard, near the Coop Store and the ATM. Take that to the lower level, cut across the theater, and head east until you arrive at the bathroom.



There is also ramp access on the south side of the building when Doms lounge is open for events.

directions: Facing the entrance to Balch auditorium, turn left and follow the path around the building (there are signs to the bathroom). At the end of the hall, enter the building, and the bathrooms are immediately to the left

directions: Enter library, cross courtyard, continue through past the desk, and the bathroom is on the left side

Building is open 8AM-5PM on weekdays only.

comment: Graffiti-tastic, too.

name: Starbucks Coffee
directions: Ask for the code. It\'s in the back, next to the parking lot.

comment:
We are a kink cafe, so are totally open and welcoming to ALL, regardless of however you define yourself!



You probably should buy something, but if you ask the staff nicely, we are totally understanding of individual situations and will let you use the bathroom!
name: Wicked Grounds
directions: Through the archway!

name: Vics Pizza
directions: The bathroom is in the back, past the bar and the water fountain. It\'s currently not very accessible to those in wheel chairs, but a new bathroom was being built last week, and it might be accessible.

comment: Co-op is open seven days a week (except for New Years Day) from 8 AM to 9 PM.
name: Olympia Food Co-op (Westside Location)
directions: Two bathrooms in the warehouse (storage section of the store.) One is large and accessible, the other is not.

name: Olympia Food Co-op (Eastside Location)
directions: Two bathrooms, both accessible. Go to the right after entering the store. One is past the fruit cooler on the right, the other is through the warehouse entryway, immediately to the left.

comment: Anyone can use the bathrooms. Just ask for a key before you use the bathroom. Both bathrooms consist of a locking door for men and women. Closed on Sundays.
name: Brooklyn Public Library
directions: The bathrooms is located near by the meeting room.

comment: Slight lip at the door, which is relatively light for being made of metal. The lock is another of those stubby little keys that turn a deadbolt, but requires only a 45-degree turn and little force.
name: I-75 NB Rest Area at MM 413
directions: In center of building, between the men's wing and the women's wing.

comment: Very nice trans friendly place to have tea, free wifi etc
name: 13th Note Cafe
directions: walk towards restaurant area at back, turn right, disabled toilet on right.

comment: Only open Thursday - Sunday when the market is open.
name: Olympia Farmers Market
directions: At the North end of the Farmers Market near the parking lot.

comment: There are showers in here, too.
name: Dockside Park

comment: Great place to do a little sticker shopping afterwards in the shop upstairs, or arrange to take the tour. Great prices & huge selection.
name: Mrs. Grossman\'s Sticker Factory
directions: Walk in the fron door towards the stairs and hook a left. Restrooms are right there.

comment: You don\'t really have to flirt - just ask.
name: Darby\'s Cafe

comment: This is a bar so it\'s open during nighttime hours. Free for 21\'s and up.
name: Manhattan Bar
directions: Straight to the back on the left. Two locking stalls.

comment: This facility is run by the city of Branson and it is clean and safe. I am not certain about the days and hours that it is open, but you can call the City of Branson at (417) 334-3345 and ask if you are planning a visit.
name: Downtown Historic Branson
directions: Located in the parking lot behind Dicks 5 & 10.  North Commercial Street (turn north at the 4-way stop in Historic Down-Town Branson, one block and it is on the left.

name: Valhalla
directions: The bathrooms are in the back of the bar!  They are generally pretty clean and have lots of space.

comment: Expect them to be open M-F 9-5 or when classes are in session.

directions:
There are two gendered single stall locking bathrooms on the east side of the studio.



The door labeled 'men' is inside a male dressing room, so it might not be as useful. However, the entrance to the bathroom labeled 'women' is not in a gendered space.

comment: Open whenever school is open. (9-5 Mon-Fri; occasionally at other times)

comment:
The hours of this building are very unreliable, since it is currently being renovated.

Beware that the elevator may be disabled for certain floors, card access may be required to enter certain floors through the stairwell, and some doors may sound alarms when opened. Beware!
name: Sprague Memorial Library, Harvey Mudd College
directions:
There is a card swipe entrance on the far west wall. There are bathrooms on each floor in the southwest corner.



1st + 4th floor: 1 \'mens\' and one \'women\'s\' restroom, single stall and locking.

2nd floor: Unknown

3rd floor: 1 unisex bathroom, with a menstrual product dispenser.

5th floor: 1 unisex bathroom with a urinal.

directions: Second floor of Atwood Memorial near the LGBT resource center. Two separate locking door restrooms.

comment: They may stop you to see if you have any unpaid for items (Because the bathroom is right inbetween two of the fitting rooms, and the counter is there for that reason.) Only one bathroom available. The building is old and the owners (Ross rents the building) refuse to remodel it, so it may not look clean.

comment: They are both labeled as Gender Neutral and are single stall locking facilities.  They are also the only public bathrooms in the building. They are open whenever the building is (7am-Midnight?)

comment: Open whenever the building is.  Card swipe access may be necessary after midnight.

comment: single stall, locking, gender neutral

name: NEW Super Walmart
directions: Go to the restroom at back of store along back wall

comment: I made these changes with some supportive professors and the Dean of Students when I attended college there. CCC is a very small Jr. College with fewer than 2,000 students (No dorms). But they have made these simple changes in a small town and no budget! Vivats to CCC. If they can do it, any college can!
name: Corning Community College
directions: 3 labeled \'Man/Woman/Handicapped\' in cafeteria building. One on first floor, two in lower floor by Student Disability Services office. One on 3rd floor of Nursing building, not handicapped accessible. They have planned for gender nuetral baths, showers, and lockers in thier new Gym biulding, in the 5-year plan.

comment: The college and I have just started a Gender Idenitity and Expression Committee to address the needs of TG students and employees. Thier mission includes enforcing non-discrimination policy, person-first language, and the dreaded bathroom/shower/lockerroom issues. The committee is made up of students, RA\'s, Staff, administratio, and community members. I am the only TG student on campus and in the committee as of this date.
name: SUNY Cortland
directions: They have single rooms with private baths to accomadate TG students. Check with Student Disability Services and housing. Must have a Doctor or Mental Health professional\'s letter stating you are TG. There are no \'pulic\' bathrooms that are nuatral anywhere else on campus, but they are working on that. Also, to access the pool at al, you must go through either the mens or ladies lockerrooms.

directions: In the very back corner. Pick up key that is attached to a silver tea pot and head right in.

name: New Frontiers Natural Market
directions: Southeast corner of building, near cash registers.

comment: Bathrooms specifically for customers only.
name: Caked
directions: 2 unisex accessible bathrooms to right of entrance.

comment:
http://www.fs.fed.us/r3/coconino/recreation/red_rock/westfork-tr.shtml

Fee required to park/use the area.
name: West Fork
street: 17.5 miles south from Flagstaff or north 9.5 miles from Sedona to about halfway between milepost 385 and 384.
directions: Several unisex toilets near parking lot, all in one shed structure.

comment: The two women that run this place are awesome, as is the food that they serve.  The bathroom is a single person room and unisex, as well as accessible.
name: Cafe Le Delice

comment: When I used it, it was well-maintained and clean.
name: The Atrium in the Arts and Journalism Building at Ball State University
directions: This unisex bathroom is located in the first floor Atrium dining area of the Arts and Journalism Building at Ball State University. If you are in the seating area (looking at the backs of the cashiers), the unisex bathroom is in a small alcove to the right. It is right next to an door that says \\\'EMPLOYEES ONLY.\\\' However, non-employees are allowed to use the bathroom.

name: Avenue Bread
directions: Turn right at the end of the counter. The two single occupancy genderfree bathrooms are down the hall on the left side, across from the kitchens.

comment:
The library is generally open every day, from 8:00 a.m. to  the afternoon or evening; it is both a public library and a college library

Here is the website: http://www.colelibrary.org/

The college is also currently working on installing gender-neutral bathrooms in other public areas of campus
name: Cole Library
directions: There are two gender neutral (single-stalled & accessible) bathrooms on the third floor of the library.

comment: 24 hours
name: Sheetz gas

comment: The Smith Music Hall is closed later in the evening to the public but in general you can go in whenever.
name: Western Oregon University
directions: Smith Music Hall by the candy machines in the main hall way of the building.

name: Kafein
directions: Look straight ahead as you enter and go to the back of the cafe.  Bathrooms are behind the counter and to the left.  All are single-occupancy.  Doors marked \'Men?\' and \'Women?\' are specifically unisex.

comment:
mon - fri 6:30am - 5:30pm
saturday - 7am-4pm
sunday - closed
restrooms for customers
name: Boyds Coffee

comment: Single stall gendered bathrooms in the basement and first floor.  Genderfree bathrooms on the second floor.
name: Portland Alano Club

comment: \"Free access\" to this single- stalled locking \"Employee Bathroom\" if the building is unlocked. From East River Parkway, look for the Weisman Art Museum just south of Washington Avenue bridge. Enter foyer at street level to the right of the vehicle entrance to the parking ramp.  After peeing in restroom, consider attending art museum by taking elevator upstairs.
name: Weisman Art Museum
directions: Bottom floor of building. Take the elevator to the bottom floor.  The restroom is right there, in the foyer. This is under the museum, near the vehicle entrance to the parking ramp.

comment:
The Brick is a gay club geared toward men who like men (especially half naked boys) but very open to all genders. You\'ll see all kinds here, lots of women, transwomen, drag queens, and a few transmen.

Go to:
http://www.brickdallas.com/
For info on hours, age restrictions, and cover charges.
name: The Brick & Joe\'s
directions:
There are several toilet locations. The first bathrooms are in the main room, at the back beyond the dancefloor/stage. These ARE gendered bathrooms. The men\'s room has three urinals and ONE toilet in a stall that locks. I haven\'t seen the women\'s.

In the second half of the club, there are three gender-free single-stall locking toilets behind the pool table. They have always been clean/well kept when I\'ve been.

comment:
A+! :) This is a student center and chapel mainly for Episcopal students of SMU. However, it is open to ALL people. The ministry is (currently) VERY inclusive, LGBTQ+ friendly and knowledgeable.
It is only open certain hours, and you might run into the chaplain or students who will want to speak to you, but for the most part anyone there will be friendly and helpful, and okay if all you want to do is pee and get out.

More info at:
http://www.canterburydallas.org/
name: Canterbury House Chapel and Student Center
directions: There are two bathrooms here with no gender markers. They are large, accessible rooms with a single toilet and sink, and extremely well kept. The first is on your immediate right when you first walk in the front door. The second is around the corner, two rights, near doors that lead to the stairway, lounge, and chapel proper.

name: Walmart
directions: In the very back, between the shoes and the crafts. Family Bathroom.

comment: They\'re large bathrooms with locking stalls. They appear pretty gender-safe--you can just walk right into them and take a stall and I don\'t think there would be a problem. Act confident.
name: Loews Theater
directions: Two locations--both gender-labeled. One is in the lobby that you can access without buying a ticket, to the right of the kiosk (adjacent bathrooms), the other adjacent bathrooms are by the theaters in the back.

comment: Located in the Pikes Peak Gay and Lesbian Community Center of Colorado Springs PPGLCC- Your Pride Center! Stop in to pee, stay to chat! 2:00pm-6:00pm Monday-Friday
name: PPGLCC Pride Center of Colorado Springs
directions: Located in the back hallway of the center just ask staff working at the entrance and they will help you. Center is located between The Bijou Bar & Grill and Paul\'s House of Hair on Bijou.

comment: Used bookstore in downtown Niantic, CT. Open 9am - 9pm every day except for Christmas and Thanksgiving. Has a one-person locking genderfree bathroom.
name: Book Barn Downtown

comment:
Really great coffee shop!
Knitting group Tuesday evenings.
Open 7am-10pm weekdays, and 8am-10pm weekends.
name: Blue Moon Coffe Cafe

comment: i\'ve only used the family bathroom near the M&T Bank, a janitor unlocked the door for me. the door closed automatically (it took a few seconds) and has a manual lock on it. I think the family bathrooms are usually open/available for use but I\'m not sure. I don\'t know which ones are accessible.
name: BWI Marshall Airport
directions:
BWI Marshall has family restrooms in many locations throughout the terminal building. There are four on Concourse A - one before security between security and the bank, one just past security near the Phillips restaurant, one at gate A9 and one in baggage claim on the lower level.

There are five family restrooms in the Concourse B area - one at security, one near the Silver Diner restaurant, one at gate B2, another at gate B7 and one at baggage claim belt 5.

Concourse C has two family restrooms - one in the upper level back hallway near the Lost & Found office and one at gate C7.

There are four near Concourse D - one is in the upper level back hallway near Bill Bateman\'s restaurant, one in the back hallway behind the Air Tran Airways ticket counter, another at gate D7 and one at baggage claim belt 12.

comment: Great coffee shop has two single-locking bathrooms that are gender-free. Enjoy!
name: Urban Beans
directions: 7th St just north of Osborn

comment: Indian-fusion restaurant, delicious.
name: Treat
directions: Through the dining room, on your right.

name: Filter Coffee Shop
directions: Straight ahead after you enter just before the swinging doors to the kitchen are two individually locking bathrooms with no signage at all.

name: Caffe de Luca
directions: Midway through the restaurant on the right side are two unisex locking bathrooms.

comment: Hours: M-W 11a-9p, Th-Sat 11a-10p, Sun 10a-4p.
name: The Electric Cheetah
directions:
Back wall of a single dining room restaurant, two gender-free locking restrooms. 

ETA: the bathrooms are now gendered because the restaurant started selling alcohol, but they still lock.

comment:
This is a very cool, clean, smoke-free gay bar. They have coffee, beer, wine, and free Pacman in the back.

Hours: M-F 8a-12, Sat 8a-2a.
name: The Ultra Lounge
directions: In the hallway past the bar. It\'s a bit cramped back there.

comment:
This restaurant is amazing. Everyone is friendly and the food is great, and can be cheap if you pick the right things. Good place for vegan, gluten-free and other food-sensitive people.

Hours: M-F 7a-8p, Sat 8a-4p.
name: Marie Catribs
directions: One locking genderfree bathroom and a locking women's room off an alcove immediately to the right as you enter from the parking lot.

name: Grand Coney
directions: Apart from the set of traditional restrooms near the kitchen, there is a genderfree one back near the ice cream counter. The genderfree restroom is only available during the day although the restaurant is often open all night.

name: Value Village
directions: in the back of the store to the left of the furniture section.

name: Spenard Shell Gas Station
directions: its to the left of the cashier counter between the wall cooler and the atm.

comment: You will feel more comfortable if you are wearing yoga/dance clothes, and possibly if you leave your shoes outside the door in the hallway.
name: Dance Home/Santa Monica Power Yoga East
directions: This is a dance/yoga studio above radio shack. The bathrooms are on through the doorway at the far corner of the space from the entrance: two single stalls on your right.

comment:
bauhaus has two single stall locking bathrooms, one that has an M and one that has a W but it is very strongly the culture of the regulars to use whatever bathroom is first available/treat them as gender neutral bathrooms, regardless of whatever bathroom people typically use or where they sit on the genderqueer spectrum.

just walk right in. you don\'t have to buy anything. bauhaus employees are some of the nicest people on earth. i go there every day and have only seen them get upset at a customer ONCE, and that\'s because he was harassing me. i love the bauhaus
name: Bauhaus
directions: Back behind the kitchen area

name: Landmark Saloon
directions: Go in the front door, and go as far straight back as possible.

comment: Queer friendly and most employees will let you use it without buying. Or just lie and say you\'ll get something when you come out.
name: Cosi coffeeshop
directions: In the back, ask for key. Handicapped accessible. Gendered bathrooms but single-person-access

name: Shoprite
directions: In the back thru the produce. Single locking bathrooms, always deserted.

comment: Two single bathrooms w/ locking doors gender neutral.
name: Whole Foods-Art museum area
directions: next to the cafe seating area next to the registers.

comment:
Best cupcakes ever (but they run out fast)!

Hours: Mon-Fri 7am-6pm, Sat & Sun 8am-5pm
name: Sweet Adeline Bakeshop
directions: Walk to the back, pass the open door to the kitchen on right. Bathroom door is immediately after this, on the right as well.

comment: There is a unisex bathroom with 2 sinks, 2 urinals and one handicap accessible stall with a slide lock. The entrance to this bathroom also locks. Another bathroom, adjacent to this one, has one locking handicap accessible stall, but the entrance to the bathroom does not lock. This building is open only from morning to 7pm and parking is not free.
name: University of South Florida
directions: Basement of the FAO (Faculty Office) building across the hall from the Women\'s and Gender Studies department\'s office. See www.usf.edu for a map of campus.

comment: This is a genderfree, handicap accessible bathroom at the friendly, accepting and warm Kaleisia Tea Lounge. There is a sign at the entrance that says \"No Bathroom\" but that is due to some unfortunate and messy incidents involving homeless persons. It would be nice of you to get a drink while you\'re there, which I think you\'ll enjoy. Tea of the month is only $2+tax and smoothies start at about $4. Free parking. If you like boba in your drinks, Kaleisia really knows how it\'s done. I won\'t take boba from anywhere else in town. www.thetealounge.com
name: Kaleisia Tea Lounge
directions: In the very back of the store, first/only door on the right.

comment: doodle\'s is fabulous. thank them!
name: Doodle\'s Restaurant
directions: 2 silver-doored, locking restrooms located on the outside of the building. they\'re on the left side if you\'re looking at the store front.

comment: Family bathroom, in addition to the male and female bathrooms

mon-sat: 8am to 8pm

At the entrance on Queen and Bay

comment: There is another restroom marked \"private\" to the left of the key desk behind a display of key accessories that is usually open to the public. The staff here is generally friendly and laid back.

comment: The food here is delicious but a little pricey for a budget, as nearly everything is a la carte. Try something out like the miso soup!
name: Truly Vegan Restaurant
directions: Enter, order something. Restrooms through the kitchen; walk into kitchen area and head back until you see a small area with a door on the left. That\'s the bathroom.

comment: I\'m nearly 100% positive that they are gender neutral. I recall there only being on restroom, and it\'s single and locking.

bathrooms are through the rear door in cafe (just to the right of the counter) and down that hallway.

name: Willkie Center Building

comment: single stall locking gender neutral / disabled bathroom.
name: Ballantine Hall
directions:
On the ground (not first) floor, by the giant globe.

Floor 5, across from 548 (not accessible, all gender)
Floor 4, across 402 (accessible, all gender)
Floor 1, across from 105 (accessible, all gender)

name: Burger King
directions: Walk in either door and walk down the stairs to the downstairs area. The bathrooms, from the stairs, are on the left side.

name: McDonald\'s (and Chipotle Mexican Grill)
directions: The bathroom is between the Chipotle and the McDonald\'s in an joined space.

comment: This building is a darn maze with lots of dead ends, but it\'s small, so you should be able to find them.
name: Reves Center
directions: Two right next to each other on second floor (one floor up from the ground floor, may actually be called third floor)

comment:
Mon-Fri 6:30am-10pm
Saturday 7am-10pm
Sunday 7am-9pm
Also they make a lot of delicious food. I specifically go there for the homemade pies.
name: Bipartisan Cafe
directions: When you walk inside the cafe there are two gender neutral bathrooms at the back of the cafe. One has a picture of an elephant on the door and the other has a picture of a donkey.

comment: I love their sushi and there are awesome folks that work there. Try the yummy vegan sushi.
name: Sushi Ichiban (formerly Takahashi)
directions: At the back of the restaurant there is a small hallway that leads to the gendered single stall bathrooms.

comment: If you\'ve got to use the bathroom give me a call (503)278-2726. My name is Drift
name: Drift\'s House
directions: I noticed that there aren\'t any listings of safe bathrooms east of 82nd in Portland. Well I just happen to live further out from the city hub and wanted to post this in case anyone ever needed the info. I live in apartment #3 of a split house. My door is through the front yard gate around the left of the house and down the stairs.

comment: Seriously should be cleaned more than once a day, but when your desperate....
name: Walmart
directions: Way in the back of the store by electronics. Its a \"family\" bathroom, but anyone can use it.

name: CafÃ© Jean-SÃ©bastien Bar & Tapas
directions: Main Floor

comment: GREAT place to eat! try the raisin bread pudding. seriously.
name: Pantry Kitchen
directions: At the back of the restaraunt, two single bathrooms with locking doors in a hallway.

name: Bedford Farms Ice Cream
directions: As you walk in the store, there will be an exit sign in the back on the right. That door is directly opposite the bathroom, near the freezers.

name: Concord Cooperative Market
directions: In the front of the store by the cash registers

name: Grendel\\

comment: locks securely, I\'ve used twice now, no problems.
name: Subway
directions: Off to the side of the tables and counter are the two single occupancy bathrooms.

comment: secure locking doors, Used several times, no problems.
name: Starbucks
directions: Past the serving counter and the seats. both single occupancy.

comment: I walk up to the ticket collector, and ask if I may use their restroom. I\'ve had no hassles. If they decline you, mention you are between genders, and are not able to use the other bathrooms. Usually the female ticket collector in the afternoons is nice and 100% no hassle. locks securely
name: Orlando Fasion Square Mall
directions: Go all the way to the end with the theater and the food court. This bathroom is in the theater and is a family restroom.

comment: ask the front desk attendant if you  may use the restroom. They don\'t care which one you use. Only reason to ask is if you aren\'t a member, you can\'t just stroll past the front desk. Never had any problems. door locks securely.
name: YMCA
directions: first floor, down the hallway towards men\'s locker room, on the right. It is a family restrom.

comment: This is a family restroom, but unlike Arizona Mills, anyone can use it.
name: Chandler Fashion Center
directions: Just west of the food court.

comment: there has been concern about IV drug use in these stalls, as well as houseless community members using them for shelter (which raises lots of other questions, such as WTF is Portland doing about homelessness (answer, nothing))
name: Portland State University Smith Hall Mezanine
directions: go up small stairs behind info desk from Broadway street door, turn left at top of stairs

name: Jones Hall
directions: First floor, to the right of the elevators.

comment: The sign requests that you only use after hours, when the building is closed, but they\'re open 24 hours, and the inside bathrooms could not be more gendered.
name: I-89 rest area between Exit 12 & Exit 13
directions: Exterior access bathrooms, single lockable doors

comment: Library hours are usually 8 am - midnight.  If you can get in the building, you can use it.  Bathroom is single stall, locking, by the elevator, and has a wide door and accessibility rails.  There is another gender-neutral bathroom at Fordham Law on the 4th floor but it is marked Faculty/Staff and not always open.
name: Fordham Law School library
directions: Library stack 6 by the elevator.

name: Giant Foods
directions: When you walk in, walk along the front of the store in front of the cash registers and check out lines heading left. The bathrooms will be on the left before the bakery and frozen foods.

comment: Not accessible after 10pm. Stall door from floor to top of stall. Known cop bathroom.
name: palmer house hilton
directions: Main lobby to the right of the front desk.

comment: Handicapped portapottie is really nice.
name: Katherine Legge Memorial Park, Hinsdale IL
street: Katherine Leggee Park, beteween 57th and plainfield on county line road
directions: Drive in entrance, bathrooms in small building behind lodge, other port-potties located throughout park with a handi-accessable porta-pottie too.

comment: open mon-sun 8am-6pm; chill atmosphere, queer and trans friendly
name: Bump N Grind Cafe
directions: all main floor, street access

comment: It\'s a tight fit in this little restaurant, especially on the weekends. Sometimes the lock on the bathroom door doesn\'t work.
name: Teresa\'s Worker Owned Cafe
directions: Main floor, street front access.

comment: I think we should all boycott Target but if you\'re going then it\'s good to know that this location has a safe place to pee.
name: Target Cascade Station
directions: When you walk into the store the bathrooms are on your right before customer service. There is a single room family bathroom that is accessible.

comment: The Cafe is open Monday through Friday. This is what they have to say about the cafe, \"Our Portland, Oregon nonprofit cafe is the heart and flagship of our organization. We are open to everyone.  We serve low cost, hot, nutritious meals that can be purchased in a variety of ways, including with cash, food stamps, or in exchange for work.\"
name: Sister\'s of the Road Cafe
directions: It is a tight fit through the cafe so it is not really accessible. The bathrooms are located at the back of the cafe. There are two gender neutral, locking single bathrooms. This is a safe space business. I know gender variant folks work there and you will be respected.

comment: There is a sign that says purchase is necessary to use the bathroom.
name: Subway
directions: Right toward the back.  One single stall non-gendered.

comment: The people here are really cool and you can just walk in and use the bathroom.  There is one bathroom directly to the back and another to the right down the hall.  Both are single stall non-gendered.
name: The Common Cup
directions: Right on the corner of Morse and Greenview.  Bathrooms are toward the back.

name: Common Roots Cafe
directions: Inside the door off the patio, take a right and they\'re right there just before the kitchen.

comment: Definitely one of my usual bathroom spots.  Just walk like you own the place (aka a wealthy hotel guest) and make your way up that beautiful grand staircase.  Really the royal treatment.  On your way down and out, consider getting a hot asian bun at Wow Bao.
name: Renaissance Downtown Chicago Hotel
directions: Enter on Wacker, close to State (through the drive entrance).  Take a left up the grand stairs, and two small bathrooms should be right there.

comment: The bathrooms are single bathrooms, however they are gendered. They are pretty much \"hidden\" down a hallway, so no one will give you any dirty looks.
name: Euphoria

comment: They lock the doors at 5PM.
name: Columbia Missourian Building
directions: Walk in through the parking lot.  It\'s an obvious door on the left of the hallway.  Usually no one is around.

comment: check library hours
name: Waterloo Public Library
directions: single stall, gendered

comment: Bathrooms are open to the public on performance nights. To learn more about us, go to http://barnstorm.ucsc.edu/
name: Barn Theater
directions: Go up the steps into the Barn. Bathrooms are located directly to the left. Handicapped bathroom to the right.

comment: Open 7AM-7PM every day.
name: Depot Bookstore and Cafe
directions: One single-stall bathroom in the seating section of the cafe.

comment: Around 6 AM to 9 PM, judging by the hours of the stores around them
name: Bon Air Shopping Center
directions: The shopping center bathrooms are outside the shops, near Peet\'s Coffee and Mollie Stone\'s Market. There\'s one single-stall, genderfree accessible bathroom and then the gendered bathrooms are set farther back.

comment:
http://www.storiesla.com/
STORE HOURS
Mon - Thur 8:30am - 8pm
Fri & Sat 8:30am - 10pm
Sunday 10am - 8pm
Call us: (213) 413-3733

They also host a queer literary open mic once a month.
name: Stories Books and Cafe
directions: If you enter from Sunset Blvd, go toward the back where the cafe is.  Pass the counter to you left, almost to the back door is the bathroom.

comment: place is run by quiet christian hippies
name: The Yellow Deli
directions: bottom floor at the back

comment: They\'re only open until 7pm.  Still, it\'s a safe and clean potty stop just across the street from the Takoma Park Metro Station.  You can also grab a pre-made vegan sandwich there if you\'re willing to pay a bit too much.
name: Mayorga Coffee - Takoma Park Metro Station
directions: Step in the main door and go down the short hall just to the right side (as you\'re facing it) of the counter.  There are 2 unisex single-seater locking restrooms, side by side.

comment: Quigley hall closes at 10pm but the west entrance is broken and locks at odd times. If you can get into the building the 3rd floor is always accessible, but after 4pm the 4th floor bathroom closes
name: Quigley Hall
directions: one on the 3rd floor on the far west end of the building labeled men\'s. Another on the 4th floor (faculty floor) on the north wall after your turn right after you climb the stairs to the top and go through a door.

name: Target Davis
directions: Go in store entrance (green door), first turn on the right after getting in the store.

comment:
Great food, excellent staff, very approachable and accommodating.
Catering to vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free diets. Omnivores welcome.
HOURS: Monday - Saturday 11am 10pm (later on weekends)
CAPACITY: 40 inside. 12 outside
RESERVATIONS: Accepted
PAYMENT: Visa, Mastercard, Debit, Cash
name: The Perch
directions: Two gender-neutral bathrooms on the main floor. One is small, the other is wheelchair accessible. There is a large, long table beside the entrance to both. It may require moving, depending on whats going on.

comment: In addition to a genderfree bathroom, they have a nice atmosphere, free wifi and lots of veg options. They will, however, ask for a name with your order.
name: Cafe del Soul

comment: No changing tables in either one.
name: Durham Performing Arts Center
directions: On ground floor, go through the unmarked door under the \"family restroom\" sign. Then there are two, down the hall and on the left.

name: Denver Aquarium
directions: Walking in, to the left is where you buy tickets and to the right is leading you to the bathroom. Walk all the way back til you can\'t walk down the hall anymore and bathrooms are right there.

comment: Depending on how busy the area is depends on whether you can get in. Remember there are several bathrooms pin pointed across the mall.
name: Park Meadows Mall
directions: Anywhere there is bathrooms located, you can find the family restroom.

name: Courthouse
directions: 3rd Floor, same wing as the family courtrooms. 2 individual restrooms (one marked male, one female) each are single-occupancy, locking door (lock not ADA, handle is). Also, all jury rooms in the courthouse that are equiped with restrooms have 2 single occupancy restrooms marked male and female. These generally are not accessable, and are reserved for jury and employee use.

name: Elon University - Academic Village Spence Pavilion
street: N Antioch Ave and Haggard Ave
directions: First and Second floors have identical bathrooms, at the end of the hall on the left

comment: Men\'s single locking bathroom
name: Elon University - Mooney Building
directions: First floor between common area and front door

comment: 2 bathrooms, both newly gender neutral.  Stroll right in and enjoy!
name: Elon University - Moseley Campus Center
directions: Second floor next to elevators

comment: Two mens single locking bathrooms.  Unfortunately, the womens is a multi-stall room.
name: Acorn Coffee Shop
directions: Back of shop

comment: Open Mon-Thu 8am-8pm ,and Fri 8am-7pm.
name: Fenway Health (formerly Fenway Community Health Center)
directions:
All of the restrooms are genderfree. 

On the ground floor, walk straight in through the glass doors, straight to the back wall, and make a right.  There are two separate gender-neutral single locking bathrooms, each with a sink.

They seem wheelchair accessible due to their size and presence of grab-bars, but I\'m not certain whether they meet all ADA requirements.

Each floor has more bathrooms in the same configuration.

comment: 11am - 9pm Monday through Saturday; Noon - 7pm Sunday
name: Good Karma Vegan Cafe

comment: Really nice bathroom.
name: McDonald\'s
directions: To the right just inside the door.

name: Valero Station (Nice N Easy)
directions: Go to the right inside the door, around the counter.

name: Target
directions: Single bathroom back next to the pharmacy counter. Go in the doors, past the registers, and walk back toward electronics. Bathroom is to the right about halfway back.

comment: No one will watch which bathroom you choose except the cats.
name: PetSmart
directions: In the back left corner of the building, past the cat adoption center.

comment: It would be most polite to buy something, but they won\'t stop you if you use the potty and run. Bathrooms are a little tight, but tolerable.
name: Garcia\'s Restaurant
directions: To the right inside the main door.

comment: Stop in when they\\\'re busy and they\\\'re unlikely to notice you. Better yet: make a donation while you\'re there!
name: Cortland County SPCA
directions: Go in the door and around to the right, and bathroom is on your left just past the first corner.

comment: Bathroom is TINY and has no sink. Intended for customers only, but if you asked nicely, they\'d probably let you use it anyway. Queer owned shop with lots of queer clients and cool, trans-friendly barbers.
name: Gene\'s Barber Stylist
directions: Inside and to the right

name: GreenStar Coop
