comment: There\'s a unisex \"family\" bathroom next to the traditional men\'s and ladies\' rooms.
name: Home Depot
directions: On the south wall (left side as you come in the main door), about halfway toward the back.

comment: Unisex \"family\" rest room; generally can only access if you\'ve purchased a movie ticket.
name: Regal Cinemas
directions: Back in the cinemas area, to the right of the ticket-taker.

name: Country Max
directions: To the far left inside the main door.

name: Wings Over Ithaca
directions: Directly between the first and second rooms, before you get to the cash register.

comment: This is a single stall, locking bathroom for females and males. Since it is past the check-in counter you probably have to be a visitor to use it.
name: Knapper Clinic at Geisinger Medical Center

comment: No one will bother you if you walk in, use the bathroom, and leave. On the other hand, the food is good, too!
name: Original Italian Pizza

name: Elon University - Moseley Center - Irazu Coffee

comment: Unlike \"family\" restrooms in the main part of the mall, Nordstrom\'s restrooms are usually available.
name: Nordstrom - Ala Moana

comment: If you\'re a patient there, you can definitely use the bathroom. I don\'t know if they\'d let you use it if you\'re not a patient. You can always claim to be one  of Dr. Xia Li\'s patients since they get such high turnover. (213) 484-1289
name: Sunmoon Urgent Care
directions: It\'s inside the door to the rest of the clinic.

comment: Great music from nationally touring bands in the evening. See their web site for menu, hours, and events at www.iotaclubandcafe.com
name: IOTA Club and Cafe
directions: Ground floor restaurant and bar. There are gender neutral, handicapped accessible bathrooms. No stairs in any public areas.

comment: Great pub with a wide beer selection, indie bands on weekends, open mike or blues jam, poetry night, experimental, electronica, jazz and improv night. See their web site at www.localsonlyindy.com.
name: Locals Only Art and Music Pub
directions: Gendered, single occupancy men\'s room that locks. Gendered, three-stall women\'s room.

comment: Must show ID to get in.
name: Marymount Manhattan College
directions: 3rd floor in the Commons, near the water machine. Door leads to two single stall, gender neutral restrooms.

comment:
Tuesday-Friday 7-5
Saturday 7-3
name: Walla Walla Bread Co.
directions: near the tables and chairs towards the back of the building

comment:
M-Th 9AM-8PM
F-S 9AM-10PM
Sun 9AM-5PM
name: Colville St. Patisserie
directions: to the right of the counter/cashier area

comment: The restrooms can only be used during library hours, check here for those http://law.lib.buffalo.edu/about/hours-location.asp Driving directions to O\\\'Brian available at the link as well.
name: University of Buffalo Law Library
directions: Go into O\\\'Brian Hall (the law school) and go up to the second floor to enter the law library. If you come across a cafe, you have gone the wrong direction, turn around and head the opposite way. Go to the back of the library and turn right to find the elevator.  Take the elevator up to any floor and find a gender neutral single stall locking restroom to your left immediatly after stepping out of the elevator.

name: Best Western Grand Manor Inn
directions: In the Rose Room (breakfast room), next to the window

comment:
Tuesday & Saturday: 11am - 6pm
Wednesday - Friday: 11am - 9pm
name: Magnet
directions: Head straight back just after the front concierge desk. Two restrooms will be on your left.

name: Cup A Joe
directions: Next to the Chelsea Theater.

name: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf
directions: On your left down the hall when you enter. You can see the doors from the sidewalk through the big windows.

name: Kmart
directions: It\'s way in the back, but often deserted.

comment: Open until 10:30
name: North Central College - Goldspohn Hall
directions: Second Floor

name: Jamila\'s Mediterranean Tunisian Cafe
directions: Walk in the door and head down the hall. Its on the right hand side right past the restaurant.

comment: Open till midnight. You might want to buy a coffee or something after you use the restroom.
name: Mojo Coffee House
directions: Enter the coffee shop and exit the back door. Go back a ways (almost to the end of the building. Its on the right hand side.

name: Teavolve
directions: al the way toward the back and turn left.

comment: Two individual locking rooms, spacious, non-gendered.
name: Starbucks
directions: All the way at the back.

comment: Closed on Sunday evenings and all Monday
name: Rainbow Cafe
directions: At the end of a little alley off King\'s Parade.  Restaurant is downstairs, toilet is on the ground floor, straight across from the entrance

comment: Open 24 hours!
name: Harold\'s Laundry

comment: A good place to go if you don\'t want to go to the bathroom at the movie theater.
name: La Costa Coffee Roasting
directions: It is in the back by the water cooler. Employees can\'t see you go in if you go through the side door that is open next to the water cooler.

comment: They have really good food there and free samples.
name: Trader Joe\'s
directions: It is in the very back in the storage area. You can ask an employee where it is.

comment: I\'ve never used this restroom without being there to buy something. Buying a smoothie or chips or something would probably be best.
name: Jamba Juice
directions: Ask an employee for the key.

name: Sea Isle City, NJ
directions: On boardwalk just off the beach

comment: rooftop bar at the la quinta inn.  awesome bar - single locking non gendered bathroom.
name: Me Bar/Sky Bar
directions: top floor!

comment: Amazing food, laid back staff, lgbt film screenings... What more could you want? I love this place!
name: McFoster\'s Natural Kind Cafe
directions: Two restrooms, one on either side by the entrance. This is a very lgbt-friendly cafe!

name: 24 Diner
directions: At the back of the restaurant.

comment: Sometimes the door is locked all day.  I\'m not sure why.
name: UNC campus- Venable Hall
directions: It\'s on the ground level next to the women\'s rest room.  take a right and another right out of the elevator.

name: Jimbo\'s
directions: It is on the left side of the smoothie/juice bar.

name: Croutons
directions: In the very back by the soda fountain.

name: Loblaws
directions: At the front of the store, after the cashes.

name: Ahora Mexican Restaurant
directions: Downstairs off the street.

name: Jock Turcott University Centre
directions: On the bottom floor near the access to the pedestrian mall - near the Foot Patrol and Community Protection offices.

comment: 6am to 6pm, possibly longer on weekends, possibly shorter in the winter. Building is accessible, but hall to bathroom might be too tight for some.
name: Java Madness
directions: Enter the front door, take the right before the counter. Door is on the left.

name: Trader Joe\'s
directions: Straight back past the cashiers. Two unisex singles.

comment: Clean, gender-neutral, and nice! Saved my butt the other day.
name: Valley View Mall
directions: Near the bathrooms by the food court. It\'s just across from the gendered bathrooms.

comment: I\'ve only gone here when I wanted to buy something so I\'m not completely sure you have to. The staff are really friendly. They have great gelato and coffee here (the only things I\'ve had here).
name: Papalecco

comment: This is located in the Lumberyard next to St. Tropez Restaurant.
name: Starbucks
Taste Coffee House
directions: in the back, to the right

comment: I\'ve used it several times with no problem.
name: Eastview Mall
directions: This is by the restrooms as you enter the main entrance. It\'s a gender-neutral \"family\" bathroom, the kind with a changing table for babies, etc. It has a locking door, and is wheelchair-accessible.

comment: Available whenever the building is open.
name: Brooks Hall, University of Georgia, North Campus
directions: From the south entrance of the building (closest to Sanford Hall, farthest from Caldwell Hall), walk straight in. It is to the right of the double doors to the stairwell.

name: Vassar College
directions:
Library Basement (Open to public)

All Dorms (need to be a student)

Most academic buildings have at least 1

comment:
Single-stall /locking gender free bathroom

This bathroom listing provided by shop owner :)
name: Sugartown Vintage Boutique
Bella Pizzeria
directions: Back through the hallway next to the register

comment: The staff is incredibly queer and queer-friendly.
name: Starbucks
directions: 1st floor in the back.  Walk to the stairs and turn.

comment: A valid University of Pennsylvania ID, state ID, or driver\'s license is needed to gain access to the building.
name: Van Pelt-Dietrich Library Center
directions: Many floors have single-stall and/or locking restrooms which are gender nonspecific.

comment: The building open to the public (not just students) but is a bit tricky to find but once you do, the staff is very cool.  Just ask for the bathroom.  The Center is located between Spruce and Locust Walk.
name: LGBT Center
directions: Two bathrooms on the 1st floor and two more on the 2nd floor.

comment: Library is the best bet.
name: Agnes Scott College
directions: In the campus center and library there are assorted gender neutral bathrooms.  Campus center requires student/staff id after 8pm.

comment: Must be 21 to enter casino
name: Horseshoe Casino
directions: One to the right of Total Rewards desk, another to the rear of the casino left of the cage and bar.

comment:
There is another bathroom that requires a key. The key is on a part of a cane that they keep by the door. Just ask they are nice :)

HOURS
SUN 8AM - 5PM,
MON-THURS 7AM - 10PM,
FRI 7AM - 11PM,
SAT 8AM - 11PM
name: Redrock Coffee
directions: Go up the stairs near the large entrance and then straight down the hall

comment:
This is a community-oriented restaurant whose very nice owner, Josh, offers lots of veggie options. Free wi-fi.
(213) 483-4458
name: Tribal Cafe
directions: From Temple Street, walk to the very back past the counter. It will be the last door on the lest.

comment: As this is a 24 hour super market, it is pretty easy to get in late at night.
name: Metro Grocery Store
directions: It is a single use, family room.  Once you enter the front door, go strait down the row of checkouts and past the flower stands.  Between the flowers and the refrigerator full of orange juice is a small hallway.  It is the first room in this hall, and should be visible right away when you reach the hall.

comment: Will need to have a ticket to get in (ie, already there to watch a movie)
name: Galaxy cinema
directions: In the hall to the theaters, there is a gender neutral family room.

comment: Open seven days a week. The food, a blend of Latin and South American, is absolutely incredible, and the posters don\'t lie when they advertise the best mojitos in New York - I recommend stopping in for a meal if you can! Casual-to-classy dress. The staff\'s pretty chill if you just need the restroom, though.
name: Ideya
directions: Just go straight from the front door and take a right when you get past the bar. There are two different bathrooms, both with unmarked doors.

comment:
Awesome food with lots of menu choices.  Great staff.  Great atmosphere. Love the layout.

After eating there with my kids one night, I thanked them for having non-gendered washrooms that were safe and accessible. Without skipping a beat, the person working the counter said Thanks for noticing. We want everyone to feel safe & comfortable here.
name: Paper Chase Cafe & Newsstand
directions: In the front door and up the stairs.  Turn to your right and up another small set of stairs.  Bathrooms are on the right.  There are two separate, single stall bathrooms with locking doors.

name: Scarborough Town Centre
directions: Lower floor near the food court has locking private washrooms  There are a few others scattered around.

comment: Look like a student.
name: Richard Roberts Building
directions: Turn left as you go in, behind the auditorium.

comment: Hours: Mon.-Thurs. 9-9; Fri.-Sat. 9-5:30; Sun. 12-5.
name: Ossining Public Library
directions: First floor, on the back wall, to the left of the circulation desk.

comment: Tiny bathroom, might not be handicap accessible.
name: Soul Full Cup
directions: Past the counter and on your right.

comment: A little isolated, but the employees are usually cool, the coffee is excellent, and the genderfree bathroom is big.
name: Heavenly Cup
directions: If you enter from the front of the building (near the counter), go right, towards the stairs, into the little nook and it\'s on your left. If you go through the side door, facing the counter but on the opposite side of the room, it\'s in the nook to your right, also facing you.

comment: One of the cleanest rest stops around.
name: Chautauqua Lake Rest Area
directions: Between the traditionally gendered restrooms - men\'s on the right, women\'s on the left. It\'s unisex/family.

comment: They have signs explaining why there are no gender signs on the bathrooms!
name: Mondragon Cafe

comment: Forest is a wacky awesome place, run by volunteers and spontaneously exploding with creativity here and there. Don\'t be surprised if these aren\'t the cleanest toilets ever though!
name: The Forest
directions: Accessible toilet is in the main cafe, other genderfree toilets downstairs in the basement.

comment: If you enter the building and just go straight, then enter the first door, you\'ll find the Women\'s Resource Center and Agency of Gender and Sexual Orientation. WRC has free feminine products and GSO can provide a list of all gender-neutral bathrooms on campus.
name: UNO Milo Bail Student Center
directions: Come in through the Dodge St. entrance (the shuttle bus pick-up). Take an immediate left and left again; there are two gender-neutral bathrooms next to the computer lab.

comment: There\'s a full-length mirror right next to the toilet, so look away if you don\'t like seeing your face while doing business!
name: Willard Straight Hall
directions: South side of the building, right next to the women\'s restroom. Single stall and locks, very brightly lit inside

comment: It\'s a UCL building, so only accessible to those with a UCL student card, but if you\'ve got any University of London ID you may be able to pretend you want a book from their library.
name: Chandler House
directions: All the toilets are gender neutral!

name: Tallahassee Community College
directions: On the first floor of the Academic Computing Center

comment: Once you are in the park, the restroom is free. It is a single occupancy, non-gendered facility.
name: Disneyland
directions: There is a family bathroom that is between the end of Main St. on the left side, before you get to the castle, and Frontierland. It\'s right by the pathway you could use to head back to Rancho del Zocalo. It\'s a tan door & building with a triangle shaped sign on it (triangle inside a circle).

name: Carleton University
directions: University Center 3rd and 4th floor.

comment: This is a gender-neutral, accessible, family restroom. All genders/ages/etc. may use this single-stall restroom.
name: Walmart
directions: Single-stall family restroom is located at the back of the store.

name: West Oaks Mall
directions: Right by the bathrooms near the food court.

comment: You need a key to get into the bathroom, but it\'s easy to snag one if you pretend you know what you\'re doing and don\'t try to get one as soon as you come into the store.
name: Dunn Bros. Coffee
directions: In the back of the building, not visible from the front of the store.

comment: This bar/restaurant has an amazing francophile aesthetic; it\'s furnished with a million antique objects from France. True to the last detail, there\'s even a \"Mixte\" single-stall bathroom as well as single-stalls for the women\'s & men\'s rooms.  Beautiful!  Classy! Gender-neutral!  yay!
name: Juliette restaurant
directions: towards the back; ask the waitstaff.

comment: they are a meeting space, believe in mutual aid, they have a food co-op library bookstore as well as selling products supporting campaigns such as Free West Papua and the Zapatista movement
name: the Autonomous Centre of Edinburgh
directions: The toilet is out the back. Also has baby changing facilities/ They aren\\\'t open all the time: every saturday 12-6pm, other times listed on their website.

name: Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf
directions: From the Main Street entrance, the bathroom is to the left of the counter.  There is a key which is chained to a metal can/pail which is usually sitting next to the bathroom on a shelf.

name: H-E-B

comment: Queer & trans-friendly.
name: Revolutionary Grounds
directions: Just walk in. It\'s a cute, small little place.

comment:
http://www.johnslunch.com/

People come from all over to have fish or clams and chips at John\'s.  If you have the time take 1/2 hour to have a great lunch for pretty cheap.
name: John\'s Lunch
directions:
Its a pretty small place and the bathrooms are in the back.  Follow the path through the tables and the counter to the back.  Turn to  your left or you\'ll walk.  Door is on the left.  Unmarked but usually left standing open. There\'s only one way so you can\'t go wrong!

Everyone is friendly so if you\'re unsure, just ask a customer or staff member and they\'ll direct you. 

Its also very busy and super popular so there is almost always a crowd at the front door. Just make y our way through.  Usually everyone moves for you anyways.  

Definitely NOT accessible.

name: Hartford Coffee Company
directions: Directly to left of front counter.

name: St. Louis Bubble Tea
directions: Locked, key given out to customers.

comment: Really good food and coffee.  Sponsors musical events upstairs.  Welcoming environment.
name: The Grind Cafe
directions: Bathroom is in the hallway going towards the back entrance.

comment: open 6am to 4am everyday! woah!
name: Hard Times Cafe
directions: all the way straight back from the door, 2 separate gender-free locking uno bathrooms on the left.  usually kinda dirty but nobody will bother you...

comment: open 7a-3p M-F, 8a-4p S-S.  staff is friendly!
name: Seward Cafe
directions: go in front door (on franklin) and branch off to the right as if you\'re headed for someone already seated to eat. you\'ll run into 2 genderfree single stall bathrooms with doors facing each other.

As far as getting to them - you can actually go to the cafe (and therefore the bathrooms) without paying.  Unless you are in a wheelchair - it is only elevator accessible from inside the Aquarium exhibit halls.

comment:
We highly reccomend TIBS.

Stellar staff.  The ONLY place to buy a good, hot cup of coffee in Dartmouth. The best croissants you'll find anywhere, hands down.  Delicious, made on site, freshly baked treats. Skilled baristas turning out delicious hot beverages. Extremely clean, large, non-gendered, accessible washrooms.  Great atmosphere for singles, couples & families. Rotating showcase of local artwork. TIBS advocates for supporting local businesses, buying local products and a renewed vision for Downtown Dartmouth.

Hours	
Mon to Fri: 7:00 am to 6:00 pm
Sat & Sun:  8:00 am to 5:00 pm

Parking	on local streets & accessible by bus.

Dartmouth Ferry Terminal is two blocks from us!

Free WI-FI available to customers!

Accept Mastercard, Visa, debit & cash payments.

Zane Kelsall - Master Barista/Co-Owner
Tara MacDonald - Baker extraordinaire/Co-Owner

Great space for groups at the huge, handmade, wooden Community Table.

Welcoming, kid friendly atmosphere.

Catering  YES!

Seasonal outdoor seating & floor to ceiling windows opening onto street level from inside.

Phone    902-469-0721
Website	 www.twoifbyseacafe.ca
Facebook Two If By Sea Cafe or
         TIBS Family Dinners
name: Two If By Sea
directions: Street level access.

name: Pickler

comment: It used to be the womens bathroom, but the mens room is so aweful men were using it. When they built the new womens room, they just let that one be for everyone.  So now there is a mens room (don't go there!), a womens room and a gender neutral room.
name: Laramie, WY/Buckhorn Bar

comment: You need a key, but just ask!
name: Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream
directions: In the back.

comment: The building is open from 10 a.m. to at least 10 p.m.!
name: Gresham Dining Hall
directions: Through front doors facing Fee Ln, directly to the right, across from the open Dining Hall doors.

comment: ID is only required after 8 p.m. on weekdays and all day on weekends, but if you ask for the restroom someone will definitely let you inside.
name: Collins LLC
directions:
Walk in the main doors of Edmonson Hall from the stone veranda; door will be directly on left. 

Another gender-neutral restroom is located on the ground floor through the door that exits to the south of Edmonson Hall.

comment: Jordan locks in the evening, sometime after 6:30 pm.  There's always random people in the Learning Center, and the part of the hall where the bathrooms are is usually empty, so don't worry about people noticing you.
name: Clemson University, Jordan Hall
directions: On the bottom floor of Jordan Hall.  If you're coming from Bryan Circle, Jordan is on the other side of Vickery Hall.  There are staircases at either end of the building and an elevator inside.  If you're coming from the south end, go past the DNA Learning Center and take the first left.  From the north end, just go down the hall and take the second left.  There's a single stall unisex wheelchair-accessible bathroom across the hall from the gendered bathrooms.

comment: 8am 5pm  Mon-Fri for sure - other times spotty
name: Carnation Building
directions: Bottom floor off the main atrium

comment: Not convenient if you're on the go, but nice if you're visiting the garden.
name: Crystal Springs Rhododendron Garden
directions: South side of the park, away from the entrance.

comment: I would say that you really don't HAVE to buy something to use the bathroom. I'm a customer now and again, but I wouldn't hesitate to just pop in and out to use the restroom on occasion.
name: Iron Bird Cafe
directions: The bathrooms are to the left of the register. No key required they are open. But they are gendered, but each are just an open room with a toilet. They have locking doors that work, and are generally very clean.

comment: Business Hours
name: Dunkin Donuts / Mobil
directions: Go in Dunkin Donuts door to the right and straight in to do you business

comment:
just enter building go to your right both male and female bath rooms are single use locking doors and kept clean.
pay cash for fuel as the pay at the pump charges a penalty for there use.
name: arco gas station and mini mart
directions: first light east of hwy 99 only gas station there.

name: Electrical Engineering building
directions: It's near the lounge (which is on the Northwestern Street side of the building), a bit south down the hall, across the open lab.

comment:
Zajimavy clanek na tema Propagacni predmety - reklamni propisky a dalsi: [url=http://www.czwww.info/reklamni-predmety-flash-disky/ ]susenky[/url] 
http://www.czwww.info/reklamni-predmety-flash-disky/
name: reklapredmety

comment: One bathroom, no "gender", locks. Never seen it dirty, either!
name: Noah's Bagels
Coca Cafe
directions: Front room, on the left.

name: Macy's
directions: 2nd floor in the petite section, by the men's restroom there is a single genderfree bathroom

comment:
Mostly accessible going by the checklist but the door handle is a knob, not a lever.

This bathroom is open 24 hours a day, like the store. It's a pretty busy store and during daytime hours no one would even notice you're not a customer. Less sure about nighttime hours, but I don't see why there would be a problem.

There are gendered bathrooms in the back of the store.
name: QFC Uptown/Queen Anne
directions: This bathroom is located on the same floor as the store, above the parking garage and below the street entrance (there are elevators.) It is by the front end, just next to the floral department and close to the elevators.

name: Warming Hut / Golden Gate Bridge
directions: two single stall locking gendered bathrooms next to gendered bathrooms

comment: Seomra Spraoi is open Monday-Friday 6pm-10pm. It is an activist social centre. While it has accessibility issues, all of its bathrooms are gender free. It is a free social space so no buying of anything is required!
name: Seomra Spraoi
directions:
Reach Mountjoy Square, which is 2 minutes walk from the central O'Connell Street.

Once there find the street that borders the square on the north, Mountjoy Square North. Belvedere Court is a small backstreet that is parallel to it.

Go down the street until you see a black door with 'Seomra Spraoi' in pink.

comment: The Exchange Dublin is a free, grassroots-run arts space in central Dublin. It's meant to be a non-commercial space for people to socialise and for arts and activist projects to be hosted. The place is open from 11am to 11pm every day. Its only bathroom is gender free, and one is not required to purchase anything to use it.
name: Exchange Dublin
directions: The Exchange is easy to find from Parliament Street, a central road in Dublin City. From Dublin Castle at the end of Parliament St, cross the road, and take a left. The first road parallel to Parliament St on the west side is Exchange Street Upper. At the bottom of it, in the corner, is The Exchange Dublin

comment: Pretty much have to be visiting the church and/or attending meetings.
name: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Kelly Point ward, Gresham, OR

comment: "Family" bathroom. Anyone can use it.
name: Clackamas Town Center
directions: Third floor between movie theater and food court.

name: Wagamama
directions: All the toilets are single stall. Some female, some gender neutral ones.

name: Parker's Piece
directions: Single stall public toilets, corner of Regent Terrace and Gonville Place. Have to pay, but are often unlocked.

name: CamYoga
directions: Toilets are on the first floor, to the right (one female, one gender neutral). Do take your shoes off as you enter the building - everyone does.

name: Cafe Project
directions: Cute little volunteer run hippie cafe. Friendly, mostly open in the evenings. Has a Safer Spaces policy.

comment: Must be 18+ to enter Sugar, but staff are super friendly!
name: Sugar
directions: Ground floor, door is right in front of the store entry.  Must ask either Sugar staff or Sprout (salon) staff for a key, but completely neutral!

comment: Their coffee is pretty good too!
name: Blue Moose
directions: At the very back on the left, there are two locking bathrooms.

name: Glenbrook Mall
directions: Family Bathroom located in food court near Sbarros.

name: My Big Fat Greek Gyro
directions: In the back of the restaurant

name: Oriental Express
directions: In the back of the restaurant, to the right of the ordering counter

comment: high-end southern cuisine w french techniques (bathrooms papered w pages from julia child, v. cute! :)
name: hungry mother
directions: 1st floor behind coat racks

comment: centre geared toward LGBT community
name: 519 community centre
directions: upstairs has gendered bathrooms and a non-gendered single stall bathroom

name: Wal-Mart
directions: Back of building near the fabric - two gendered restrooms and then a family restroom

name: Sir Pizza
directions: Go to the back of the restaurant. There's a single men's room straight ahead and a single women's room to the right.

name: Boda Furniture
directions: First floor, take a right from the entrance, go past the stairs and take a left, all the way in the back to the left.

comment: Don't think there's an elevator to the 2nd floor unfortunately.
name: Albany Antique Mall
directions: 2nd floor in the back. There's probably some kind of restroom on the 1st floor, but I didn't happen to see it.

name: Sacramento International Airport
directions: They are next to every restroom.

comment: This is past security.
name: Austin-Bergstrom International Airport9
directions: It is across from Gate 11. I don't know if there are others.

name: Walmart
directions: Back of the store

comment: This is actually the address for the Barnes and Nobles. The Starbucks is right next to the bookstore. There is an entrance to it through the front side of the store.
name: Starbucks

comment: I have only used it while buying something but you probably won't have a problem if you use it when you aren't.
name: Bunnery Cafe
Old City Market
directions: It is next to the other restrooms in one of the end market sections.

comment: You have to pay admission to use the restroom. It is a very interesting museum though. They have a single stall unisex restroom and then a single stall women's room.
name: Old Slave Mart Museum

comment: The restroom is for customers only. You can probably pretend that you have already bought tickets or something but you should probably just pay and go on the tour of the mansion. It is pretty interesting.
name: The Calhoun Mansion
directions: It is in the museum gift shop.

name: MacArthur Center
directions: First floor definitly... possibly a family restroom on third floor near food court as well

comment: Open M-F 8:30-5:30 and Sat 9-noon
name: Family Horizons Credit Union
directions: Come in the front doors and go to your right around the corner past the lobby.

comment: Wang Chung's is a small karaoke bar with a mostly queer/ally clientle so you support it if you can!
name: Wang Chung's
directions: Restroom is located around back of the building, making it easier if you're in the neighborhood but aren't specifically going to Wang Chung's.  If you're standing outside the front door, make two rights around back and you'll find the single-stall, gender-neutral restroom.

name: BambuTwo
directions: Located in the back of the bar.  One of the only true genderfree bathrooms I've found in Hawaii!

comment: There is no key for the bathroom here, you can go right in. They would probably prefer you buy something, but if you don't do it all the time I'm sure they wouldn't say anything. They're even open nice and late. M-Th: 7am-11pm Fri:7am-12am Sat: 8a-12a Sun: 8am-11pm
name: Revue Cafe/Coffee
directions: There are two. When you walk in the front door, there is one to the right. It looks to be nearly behind the counter, but you walk between the counter and the sink, and it's back there. The second one is at the very back. Walk straight back, through the curtains (which are pulled back) and to the back of the very large room. This back room doubles as a venue for music/events, so if you go after 7pm there might not be access to the back one.

comment: The people who work here are generally pretty friendly. Mon-Sun 9 am - 11 pm
name: Teazer
directions: You must ask for the key at the register. Walk toward the back, back a left and then a right into the hallway.

comment: This location of Teazer is in Riverpark, a large shopping center. Teazer is located near the back door of Borders.
name: Teazer World Tea Market
directions: Hard to describe since there are two doors, but the place is tiny. You must get the key from the register. If you're facing the cash register it's to the right and back. There is usually a screen standing near the door since it opens out into the seating area.

name: Eleanor Hackleman Park
directions: Shouldn't be too hard to find, it's the only bathroom building and the park is pretty small.

comment: usually thursday -- sundays from one to six. or whenever, if its open... the museum "must be seen to be believed."
name: the main street museum
directions: theres even a chalk board wall. write on it, not the regular walls...

comment: This is a nice place, nice employees, friendly open-minded persons! The whole store is vegetarian and filled with delicious food and cruelty-free body care and cleaning products!
name: Community Market
directions: This is a one story natural foods market. Just walk toward the left side of the back of the store, there is an office and then two single stall locking bathrooms, gender is not specified for either bathroom, both are identical and for whatever gender you identify with!

comment: Public family restroom. One occupant toilet.
name: 2nd floor near Holsteins, Cosmopolitan
directions: 2nd floor down the restroom hallway. There is a family restroom further down from the main restrooms in the hall. In the East side of hotel

name: Roehampton University Bar
directions: To the right of the bar. Just walk in, no one will ask for I.D!

name: Second Cup
directions:
At the SouthWest corner of Queen W. & John.

Main floor, back of the coffee house.

name: Chi Ko Roo
directions: Restaurant.  Bathrooms are on the first floor, but accessibility is somewhat restricted by the narrow-ish hallway and tighter corners.

comment: Two "family" single room bathrooms. I have gone to this mall cross dressing and had to use these bathrooms. Anyone can use them and it is a much better option than having to choose. Plus they are MUCH cleaner than the gender assigned bathrooms :D
name: superstition springs mall
directions: On the 2nd floor, down the hall way beside the gender assigned bathrooms.

comment: We're a co-op, too.
name: Come As You Are
directions: Just come right in!

name: Starbucks
directions: Back of store

comment: Open 11 AM to 9 PM every day.
name: Doug's Fish Fry
directions: Single-stall ungendered handicap accessible rest room, located near the back door. No one will bother you if you just walk in and use it.

comment: Usually open 12-5 Mon-Fri. Space is technically wheelchair accessible but there are no automatic doors. Someone would have to open them for you if you use a wheelchair.
name: 2110 Centre for Gender Advocacy
directions: On the ground floor. From the outside door continue straight through a second door (on the left) and go through to the end of the hallway. The bathroom is on your left.

comment: Great wine selection in the heart of Houston's Montrose area!
name: Boheme Cafe and Wine Bar

comment: Open 24/7, marked as Family Restroom with symbols for male, female, and people with disablities. Includes a bench.
name: I-75 NB Rest Area at MM 345.7
directions: Freestanding structure between the men's and women's sides of the building, on the east side of the building.

comment: Available 24/7. Moderately accessible; the door is heavy and shuts itself, but the lock is small and stubby and requires more than a full 360-degree turn to close the deadbolt. There is a slight lip in the doorway plate which may require a bit more strength than a flat entrance, which does not combine well with the heavy, self-closing door.
name: I-75 NB Rest Area at MM 383 (Paynes Prairie)
directions: On the women's side of the building, to the left and right of the entrance to the hallway leading to the women's communal restrooms.

comment: Monday through Thursay 8 AM to 8 PM only.  Closed Friday at 5 PM.  Building is locked otherwise.
name: Brighton Allston Mental Health Association
directions: Brighton Allston Mental Health is in Building #2. The main building has gendered bathrooms with separate stalls, but Building #2 has an accessible, single, gender-free bathroom on the first floor, as well as two locked, single-stall gendered bathrooms on the basement level.

comment: 1-5 pm, M-F, open most week nights for meetings, etc
name: Transgender Center
directions: Walk in, say hi to the Center worker and ask for the bathroom.

comment: Very filling, tasty food! Not just pizza.
name: Giovanni's Pizza
directions: Past the counter, to the left.

name: Planet Sub
directions: Straight back from front door; it's a small place, should be very easy to find.

name: LIMEberry
directions: Take a right from the front door. It's a tiny store so it should be easy to find.

name: Read All Over
directions: In the back on the first floor. Sort of hard to find -- it's past the stage.

comment:
Latitude: 44.6384162652
Longitude: -123.160342038

Pretty park.
name: Hyak Park
directions: Stand-alone bathroom shack, should be easy to spot.

comment: Closed at night
name: Takena Landing Park
directions: Stand alone bathroom shack near the parking lot.

comment: clean! In a quiet space. Safe bathrooms are, historically, rare on campus
name: Fredericton/Margeret Norrie Study Hall/STU
directions: First floor of the study hall in Margaret Norrie, go in and to the left.

comment: There is a key in a white bowl next to the front counter. If you have trouble, just ask a receptionist for the key.
name: Johnson & Wales University Student Services Building

comment: Restroom is a single stall locked facility.
name: Johnson & Wales University Wales Hall Counseling Services

Counseling Services
2nd Floor

name: Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Biloxi
directions: Near the entrance, and on the east and west sides of the casino floor.

comment: Building open from 8:30am-6pm Mon-Thurs. 8:30am-5:30pm Fri. Stop at the front desk on the way in and ask for a brochure or newsletter.
name: Birthingway College of Midwifery
directions:
First Floor has accessible bathroom.
Second and basement floors have genderfree non-accessible bathrooms.

comment: Family bathroom (I think it is up near the food court)
name: North Star Mall
Bistro Market
directions: Back of Store, south of meat section

comment: free after entry, multi-stall unisex bathrooms, everyone stands online together
name: PS 1
directions: multiple floors

comment: Friendly (and funky) staff. Open 6am-10pm most days, 7am on weekends.
name: Willow Glen Coffee Roasting Company
directions: Walk directly to the back, past the counter.  Door is on the right.

comment: Great food! And just one unisex bathroom for everyone.
name: Outpost Cafe
directions: In the big rooom around the corner.

comment: This is a Chinese restaurant that has one male/female locking restroom. You'd definitely want to be eating a meal here to use the restroom.  But it's tasty food, and affordable.
name: Nan King Road Bistro

comment:
i've never had any problems there using either bathroom. and you pretty much don't have to buy anything.

the bathrooms MIGHT be accessible. i don't know.
name: St Marks Cafe
directions: just walk in to the back, turn left.

comment:
it's a pretty cool place and you should probably be able to use the bathroom for free

the bathrooms *might* be accessible, but i'm not sure.
name: Pablos Coffee
directions: just walk in and keep going forward. the women's room is right there in front of you, the men's is around the corner to the left

comment: Technically only open to the public during show runs. But if you see people there working (cars in p. lot that is not a bus stop), feel free to knock, come in through the green room (white door), and ask. They'll let you. Two bathrooms: one in the green room and a public one in the hallway.
name: Lexington Park, MD/Three Notch Theatre/Newtowne Players
directions: In hallway, past men's and women's (look for the sign). Across from wooden, doube door Green Room entrance.

comment: Self-seated restaurant, but since it's behind the counter, someone may ask what you're doing. Tell them you've stopped by to give something to a friend in the seating area or just buy a bottled drink. They also sell high-end wine, so you could tell them you've come to check out their collection.
name: Blue Wind Gourmet
directions: Turn left when you enter, walk around counter until it ends, turn right and sort of go behind it.

comment: Not open long after 5:00 or 6:00 PM. Technically only for customers.
name: Brewing Grounds
directions: Straight back after entering, locking door.

comment: Technically for customers only. Open all day until 8:00 or 9:00
name: Coffee Quarter
directions: Halfway back, on left, in the alcove.

name: Westfield Shopping Mall
directions: First level, Food Ct. Turn left soon after entrance from outside. Walk down short hallway and look for sign - Family Restroom!

name: Subway
directions: Straight back, to the right

name: usc norris
directions: Enter the lobby. Take a left,turn right at the conference room. The hallway you enter has two gender neutral bathrooms.

comment: It's a tiny coffee shop, who's also a cultural space and hosting from time to time theater plays
name: L'Artisto
directions: It's easier to come from "Avenue Taeb M'hiri" then from "Avenue de la Libert/Avenue Hdi Chaker"

comment: This place is rather small, so the rooms are easy to find, but it is easy for the employees to notice you.  It's defiantly not a "customers only" type thing, but getting something is probably the polite thing.
name: Dairy Queen
directions: There are two gendered single use rooms.  After entering the store, turn left to the side of the counter.  Go past the tables lining the windows, they are at the back.

comment: This Portland Loo sidewalk toilet is open 24/7
name: Portland Loo (#2)
street: SW Naito Parkway at Ash Street

comment: This single stall gender neutral Portland Loo is open 24/7.
name: Portland Loo
street: SW Naito Parkway at SW Taylor Street

comment: This award-winning, single stall gender-neutral Portland Loo is open 24/7.
name: Jamison Square
street: NW 10th St at NW Johnson St.

comment: This clean, safe, award-winning, gender-neutral single stall Portland Loo is open 24/7.
name: Portland Loo

comment: This award-winning, free, single stall, gender-neutral sidewalk toilet is open 24/7.
name: Portland Loo
street: NW 10th St at NW Johnson St.

comment: They also have fantastic pizza!
name: Villa Teresa, Susquehanna Valley Mall
directions: Close to JC Penny's. Next to Waldenbooks and across from FYE. In the back of the restaurant, behind a wall.

comment: They serve delicious ice cream!
name: Maurer's Dairy & Ice Cream Shop
directions: Past the counter, to the left.

comment: Available 24/7. Door locks with a light touch of a button in the handle.
name: I-75 NB Rest Area at MM 85
directions: On the women's side of the building.

comment: Available 24/7. The paved path runs zigzag for several meters; able-bodied people can walk a more direct (but unpaved) path.
name: I-75 NB Rest Area at MM 108
directions:
There are two genderfree bathrooms on the men's side of the building. The genderfree bathroom nearest to the parking lot is somewhat accessible (door closes automatically and locks with light force to effect a 90-degree turn) but kind of gross. 

The door on the further bathroom is so difficult to shove shut (or yank open), even for a strong able-bodied person, that I would not recommend it to any user until it's repaired.

comment: Available 24/7. Both genderfree bathrooms have wooden doors that do not close automatically and lock with a 90-degree turn of a small handle. The bathroom further from the car parking area (closer to the truck parking area) has a door that is somewhat difficult to close and open; a moderate amount of effort is needed. The other bathroom -- the one closer to the car parking lot -- is easier to open and close.
name: I-475 NB Rest Area at MM 7
directions: Two genderfree bathrooms on the men's side of the building.

name: Student's Union
directions: There is a gender-neutral toilet in the student union. I think it's on the third floor. If you can't find it, just ask at the front desk and they'll be happy to direct you.

name: I-75 SB Rest Area at MM 179
directions: Located in the Welcome Center building, but locked up at night. Only the multi-user, gender-segregated restrooms are open 24/7.

name: I-75 SB Rest Area at MM 118
directions: Two genderfree restrooms on the men's side of the building. Available 24/7, but when I visited at 5am Saturday the lights were out in both genderfree restrooms (but not the segregated restrooms). The electric hand dryer did work, though, so I'm not sure what was up with the darkness.

name: I-75 SB Rest Area at MM 76
directions: On the women's side of the building, closer to truck parking than car parking. Hours not posted; door was locked at 6am Saturday but may have just been in use.

name: I-75 SB Rest Area at MM 49
directions: One genderfree restroom on the women's side of the building. Presumably 24/7 but was locked or in use on my visit.

name: Publix
directions: Two genderfree accessible bathrooms at the front of the store (on the east side in the pharmacy area). Restrooms at rear of store not investigated but are usually segregated and multi-user in Publix.

comment: It's good ice cream and the bathroom is for patrons only so you should buy some!
name: Cold Stone Creamery #1358
directions: Walk straight back past line of people waiting to buy ice cream.

name: Stewart's Shop
directions: Two gender-neutral bathrooms.  Very clean.

comment: Clean restroom; gendered bathrooms also available.
name: Kohls
directions: In the back of the store, in the customer service area

comment: Not the cleanest, but no one says anything if you use the "wrong" restroom (I am transman and a cismale left and looked at me and said "all yours"; I don't pass a lot).  Single stall.
name: Foster's Freeze
directions: To the left of the counter, male restroom first, then female.

comment: 9am to 8:30pm during school year, 9am to 4:30pm during summer
name: Sarah Lawrence College Library
directions: Bottom floor, elevator available

comment: Open 7am-10pm.
name: Publix
directions: , Suite A100. Restrooms are at the front of the store. One genderfree bathroom is located between the two gendered bathrooms.

comment: Clean, easy to get to, employees are mad chill, they'll even point them out to you.
name: Trader Joe's
directions: Head to the back of the store, they're thru the double doors.

comment: Hours of operation can be found here: http://www.slsc.org/
name: St Louis Science Center
directions: Multiple places within, but easiest to find is straight through the north entrance under the weird round nuclear-tower-looking-thingy, between the men's and women's restrooms.

name: Dots
directions: Ask for restroom, it\'s in the back room, visible through a door past the dressing rooms

name: Millville Marathon
directions: Around the counter to the right, along back wall, not immediately visible from front doors

comment: The key is to walk right in like you own the place, or you\\\'ll stick out as not being a guest.
name: Central West End Hotel (Comfort Inn)
directions: In the back: go through the main door, continue straight on to the back of the hotel, turn left and they are on the right.

comment: We are open Monday to Friday 10 am to 5 pm and Wednesdays until 8 pm.
name: The Blue Frog
directions: Walk right in and look around! The bathrooms are in the back!

name: Quiznos
directions: At the back of the building, here is a door with both a men's sign and a women's sign.

name: Taco Time
directions: At the east entrance, there are two restrooms, one for men and one for women.

name: Albertsons
directions: At the back of the store by the bakery.

name: Sharp's Burger Ranch
directions: Near the salad bar, there's a door that says "Restrooms". Inside, there are two gendered single stall restrooms

name: Safeway
directions: At the back of the store between the pharmacy and the milk section. Possibly a family restroom.

comment: Also an awesome coffee shop!
name: Coffee Evolution
directions: Downstairs, single non-gendered stall

comment: noisy and generally busy.  possible to walk in and out just to use restroom.
name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
directions: to the right and into the back hallway

name: Cinemark Theater
directions: Family single stall bathrooms near the theaters; there is a fee to enter.

name: Shoppers Drug Mart
directions: at the back to the right of the pharmacy near health suplements, the door is marked staff only but no need to ask

name: Murphy Gas
directions: 1.7 miles north of I-10 exit 10. If it's locked, it's in use.

comment:
WARNING: Providence College is a Catholic college. Harassment is very unlikely, but just something to keep in mind.

If driving, security may ask for your intent. Just say "Using the library." The library staff also might ask you to "sign in".
name: Providence College - Phillips Memorial Library
directions:
Use River/Eaton entrance.  Take first right and follow the parking lot up the hill. Library is at top of parking lot - entrance on the left. 

There is a single-stall, accessible bathroom on the first floor. Take a right after the staircases. Right near the water fountain and men's bathroom.

name: USF Marshall Student Center
directions: One on each floor, North of campus near Fletcher.

name: Quizno's
directions: Straight back

comment:
Fantastic, queer-friendly bookstore/cafe/gaming area with lots of nerdy points of interest.

Hours: M-Th 12p-11p, F+Sa 12p-12a.
name: Off The Beaten Path
directions: To the right, in the back past the used books.

comment: There are three single bathrooms - one labeled men, one woman, one both/either.
name: Piranha Killer Sushi
directions: Back of restaurant.

comment: Hours Mon-Sat, 9:30AM-9PM, Sun 12:30PM-6:30PM. Bathroom is free & open to public though meant for customers. So take a minute to look around store and/or buy a book--support independent bookstores!
name: Blue Elephant Book Shop
directions: Go straight in thru front entrance, pass front desk on right, into the hall. Bathroom is the first hall door on the right, a locking genderfree single stall room.

name: World Exchange Centre
directions: first floor

comment: I think it used to be Male/Female, but now it's just TWO UNISEX ROOMS! YES!!!!
name: Dairy Queen
Bean & Leaf
directions: come in through the front door and turn right and the second and third doors on the left are bathrooms!

comment: The crepes are pretty good.
name: Crepe It Up
directions: Main floor with one genderfree toilet on either end of the cafe.

comment: No ID required for access, but it is intended for students. It\'s a community college, though, so \'students\' doesn\'t require an age range or anything
name: Miami University Hamilton
directions: Schwarm Dining Hall, behind Harrier\'s Nest - down side hallway, left into doorway, immediate left.

name: Dollar Tree

comment: Office hours are 8:30-5 Monday-Friday. You can come in through the back door, but they prefer you use the main entrance. Please ring the bell in the waiting room or otherwise get an employee's attention and tell them you just need to use the public restroom. They're allies and shouldn't give you a hard time; they just need to know who's on the premises at all times and why, since they provide confidential services. The restroom would not meet ADA standards, but it's more accessible than standard bathroom stalls. The toilet seat is standard height but there's a plastic "booster" seat you can take on and off. It's a single toilet room with urinal and sink, with a door that locks. (Turn knob, and you have to push in and turn to lock it.) They have posted that PAS/help is available by staff (usually all female)upon request.
name: Crisis Intervention Services
directions: Located in the United Way building across the street from Hy-Vee. There are several disabled parking spots located directly across from the main entrance by the lot on the east side of the building (towards Hy-Vee). You enter through 2 outer pull handle doors and there are no steps. Go to the far right corner of the main room when you enter, and go down the hall to the 2nd door on your left (Crisis Intervention Services office). Go through the waiting room and keep going straight toward the back door. The public restroom is on the left just past the kitchen area. Parking is also available along the north side of the building and you can enter through the back door (lever handle), after climbing 1 step. The public restroom is on your right as soon as you come in the back door.

Even though it feels like the person you once loved is now your worst enemy, try to overcome your anger and bitterness, especially when children are involved. An enrolled agent training course is worth considering for tax practitioners to obtain a clear understanding of the intricate considerations in this matter. [URL=http://lopolikumino.com ]hysteric[/URL] If you find your mind wandering off to the past, STOP - bring your focus back to the present and the task at hand. Anciently, Mars ruled Aries and Scorpio, Venus ruled Taurus and Libra, Mercury ruled Virgo and Gemini, Jupiter ruled Sagittarius and Pisces and Saturn ruled Capricorn and Aquarius.
name: hylejohupa

AND there\\\'s a room for changing diapers as well. 

Outside on BOTH floors there\\\'s lockers, big enough to put your coat and shopping bags. You need a 5 kr coin to use them. BUT you get them back when you get your things.
