comment: In back of shop to the right.
name: Cafe Moustache

comment: 8am-10pm M-Sat, 8am-9pm Sunday
name: Target
directions: Right inside the front door just before the gendered bathrooms is a gender neutral \"family\" restroom

comment: Clinic hours are 8:30am-4:30pm, Monday through Friday
name: Project WISH at the University of Illinois at Chicago
directions: Take elevator to lower level, follow orange signs to Project WISH.

comment: Typically open from 7am-10pm
name: Yellowjacket Union, University of Wisconsin-Superior
directions: First floor, behind Residence Life/Yellowjacket Union desk in hallway

comment: Building typically open 7am-10pm
name: Yellowjacket Union, University of Wisconsin-Superior
directions: 2nd floor, across from rooms 203/204 by end of hallway.

comment: It has a cute paper sign which combines the male and female gender symbols into one.
name: The Pita Pit
directions: Around a bit of a corner towards the back.

comment: They have an ice cream machine!  It wasn\'t working when I was there, though. :-(
name: Philo Country Store
street: Washington St. and N. Lincoln St.
directions: There\'s a tiny non-gendered bathroom right next to all the alcohol.

comment: Business hours. 2 single gendered restrooms, but everyone uses whichever is open.
name: QSaltLake office building
directions: 2nd floor.

name: Smugglers\' Notch Resort
directions: Village Center by the Front Desk in lobby

comment: Hopefully there isn\'t a wedding you\'re crashing
name: The Barn at Boyden Farm
directions: In the barn, back left of building

name: Madonna Mobil
directions: enter retail complex, go left.

comment: Single stall gender neutral bathroom. The building is open from roughly 8:30 AM to 11:30 AM  on Sundays. The congregation is really welcoming of trans* people if you\'d like to stay for services
name: Unitarian Congregation of West Chester
directions: In the front door and on the left

comment: Single stall gender neutral bathroom
name: Senora\'s Authentic Mexican

comment: Maybe just look like you\'re thinking about buying something. It\'s a single stall bathroom and it\'s not the cleanest. It might say it\'s gendered but it isn\'t really.
name: 907 Paoli Pike
directions: In the middle of the back, then go through the doors that have an arrow that says bathroom and it\'ll be on your left

comment: Open Monday through Friday 8am until 5pm
name: Purdue University LGBTQ Center
directions: Engineering Administration Building - ENAD room 301

comment: Open Monday-Thursday 10am til 4pm. Open Friday and Saturday 10am til \'late\'. Open Sunday 10am til 5pm.
name: Miss Peapod\'s
directions: Past the counter, on your right. Through the door at the end.

comment: Has a genderless disabled/baby-changing single-stall toilet.
name: Truro Bus Station
directions: Public toilets behind the bus station at the end of Lemon Quay.

comment: Single-stall, genderless. Because the counter is in the way, if it\'s busy and nobody is looking around the side of the counter, you can probably slip in without buying most of the time. (It\'s also a really nice vegetarian cafe, though.)
name: Cafe Cinnamon
directions: Immediately to the left of the entrance.

comment: Open weekdays 8a-5p for non-residents. Residents have access 24/7
name: Diamond Village Commons

comment: Open weekdays 8a-5p for non-residents. Residents have access 24/7
name: Springs Complex Commons
directions: 3 bathrooms located upstairs in the Commons Building. Open weekdays 8a-5p for non-residents. Residents have access 24/7

name: Tolbert Hall
directions: Bathrooms located in the first floor lobby. Restricted access to residents only.

name: Tolbert Hall Ground Floor
directions: Bathrooms located in the ground floor learning community entryway. Restricted access to Tolbert Hall and North Hall residents only.

name: North Hall
directions: Bathrooms located in the first floor lobby. Restricted access to North Hall residents only.

name: Simpson Hall
directions: Bathrooms located in the ground floor hallway across from the laundry room and elevators. Restricted access to residents only.

name: El Agave
directions: In the back to the left, down a hallway. Single gendered locking restrooms, women\'s has a baby changing station. Men\'s has urinal and toilet.

comment:
The church is open Sunday mornings before the 11am service until around 1pm.  There are weekly groups that meet there as well and it is an open and affirming congregation.  
Website:  http://harboruu.org/
name: Harbor Unitarian Universalist Congregation
directions: The bathroom on the main floor is just off the social hall next to the kitchen and at the top of the stairs to the basement.  The bathroom in the basement is on the back side of the church near the nursery.  Both are small and since there are stairs leading to either, are not handicap accessible.

comment: Marked as a family restroom and has a fairly rude poster stating it should only be used as such. I didn\'t face harassment but when I went it was empty and I technically had a parent with me.
name: Shopping Metro Tatuape
directions: Look for \"Espaco Familia\" in the mall\'s maps on the Shopping (as opposed to Boulevard) side.

comment: This public washroom near the beautiful Lunenburg waterfront is proudly decorated with tiles printed with artwork donated by students of Lunenburg Academy elementary school. Contains a genderfree washroom labelled \"Family\".
name: Lunenburg public washroom

comment: Marked as a family restroom.
name: Campinas Shopping
directions: Middle floor\'s food court.

comment: Two single stall bathrooms, locking doors, no signs designating gender
name: Tres Jalapenos
directions: 1st floor, on the right side of the restaurant

comment: Buy something too, staff is great :)
name: Dunn Bros Coffee
directions: It\'s in the back. There is also a back door access from the parking lot that you can use; walk straight in.

comment: Great pizza mmm
name: Black Sheep Pizza
directions: Small joint, will look weird if you go in to use the bathroom without buying something. Bathroom is thru the restaurant and near the back

name: Caribou Coffee
directions: You will need a key from Caribou but you do not need to buy something since the bathroom belongs to the building

comment: Very queer-friendly.
name: Max\'s Empanadas
directions: All the way in the back, last door on the left.

comment: M-F and hours are 9am-6pm
name: LGBT Visitor Center
directions: Located on the 1st Floor of Historic City Hall - the LGBT Visitor Center is a safe and welcoming space for all!

name: Pizza Hut
directions: To the left past the cash register.

comment: There is no changing table for people with special needs only individualized genderfree stalls with doors.
name: Military Circle Mall
directions: In the food court area.

comment: There is a toilet area and changing table for people with special needs up to 4 to 5 inches.  And numerous gender restrooms.
name: Lynnhaven Mall
directions: First Floor and Second Floor

name: FRED MEYER
directions: go to the area of the store labled as \"bathrooms\" (down a hallway) and right before you get to the gendered bathrooms on the left there is a single room, non gendered bathroom.

comment: This is a university building, there is security present.  Also has changing tables, for anyone with kids!
name: VCU Snead Hall - School of Business
directions: There is a \'family\' bathroom located on each floor, next to the gendered restrooms in the very center of the building.

comment:
Mon - Thu, 9 am - 5 pm
Fri - Sat, Closed
Sunday, 9 am - 12:30 pm
name: Resurrection Metropolitan Community Church

comment: There is a family washroom and a wheelchair accessible washroom.
name: Hazeldean Mall
directions: In the food court, across from the Subway.

comment: Open all hours, self-locking, self-cleaning
name: street located

comment: Closed Sundays.
name: Soulfood Cafe
directions: Right at the back up the stairs. Accessible from the outside if the back door is open

comment: It might be a bit smelly, but atleast people will leave you alone
name: Johnston Canyon
street: 25km west of Banff on the Bow Valley Parkway, Hwy 1A Banff
directions: There are two outhouses outside. They are really close to gendered bathrooms with running water. They are across the bridge of the restaurant

name: Tiffys Family Restaurant
directions: Rear of restaurant - previous gendered restrooms that have been resdesignated as gender neutral

name: Taco Bell
directions: Enter in the door off Potomac to not have to walk past the main dining area.

comment:
9am to 9pm every day.
Now accessible!
name: LGBT Center
directions: Strike up a convo with the people here, they are very friendly.

name: Sherbourne Health Centre
directions: Entrance is located off the parking lot (1 min south of Carlton/Sherbourne junction and 506 streetcar), you can go to Bathrooms on the right, or you can pass the elevators to a bathroom by a second waiting area. (Less busy than the first ones) You can take elevator to 2nd floor and turn left out of the elevator and walk toward waiting area, it\'s on the left.

comment: Cleaned regularly and no-one ever asks twice, especially as I look between-gendered ;)
name: Charlestown Square
directions: Single Stall Accessible toilets all over Charlestown Square

name: Wheatfields Bakery
directions: There are two single locking male/female bathrooms in the bakery.  As you walk in, turn left and you will find them before the back seating area.

comment: They use seasonal ingredients; everything we had was really good!
name: East by Northeast
directions: Small restaurant, only one restroom.

comment: Try the breakfast sandwich with avocado/edamame spread!
name: Fazenda
directions: employee has to buzz you in to the restroom.

comment: Can be used to try on purchased clothes from the store.
name: Walmart Supercenter
directions: Family bathroom located in an alcove in the back of the store near the center.

comment: A little tricky to find, but almost always empty because of that.
name: Dolce Spazio Gelato
directions: The bathroom is behind the cafe. If you\'re facing it, go to the right and enter the gap between the cafe wall and a big tree, then go up the stairs.

name: Good For Her
directions: Upstairs

name: l\\Federal Triangle Metro
directions: Metro Stn is a little further from the marker, but much closer than L\'Enfant

comment: I\'m not sure if this is technically a customer restroom, but they let me use it and it\'s a single stall, gender free.
name: Maine Lobster Outlet
directions: Behind the counter of the nice people selling you lobster

comment: Both restrooms are wheelchair accessible, single toilet, restrooms with locking doors, though if you\'re in a hurry, I suggest going upstairs as there is always a line on the second floor during busy hours.
name: Macy\'s -Green Hills Mall
directions:
2nd floor of Macy\'s in the Swimsuit/Coats department, to the right of the Hillsborough road entrance if you\'re coming in.
3rd floor far right corner of the children\'s department when you get off the escalator, by the salon.

comment: This map isn\'t very accurate.  It\'s actually just west of Suncrest.  You can find the hours at http://thelosc.org/lakeside
name: Lakeside Community Library
directions: The only bathroom in the library, right next to the audiobooks.

comment: Only open to non-residents Monday-Friday 8am-5pm
name: Corry Village Commons
directions: Only open to non-residents Monday-Friday 8am-5pm

comment: Teaches offices are locatated on levels 4-13. There is a charge for UMSL parking.
name: Social Science Building Tower (UMSL-North Campus)
directions: All bathrooms in the tower levels 3-13 are single stall.

name: University of Wisconsin-Waukesha
directions: Northview 102 & 104. Bathrooms are marked with unisex bathroom signs. Second hallway on the left coming from the library.

name: University of Wisconsin-Waukesha
directions:
Commons 134.
Bathroom is marked with a unisex bathroom sign. Down the hallway for C126-132 that leads to parking lot 2. Across the hall from the LGBTQIA Resource Center.

comment:
Wed-Sun: 11am-6pm
First Friday: 6pm-9pm
name: 311 West Martin Street Galleries & Studios
directions: About halfway down the hall on the left in the kitchen.

name: University of Wisconsin-Waukesha
directions: Southview Basement 7 & 9. Bathrooms are marked with unisex bathroom signs. Follow the sign for the theatre scene shop in the basement level of the building.

comment: 7am-7pm Mon-Sun. This is a LGBT friendly cafe. Also next door is The Exchange for LGBT information and clinic.
name: Cafe Southside
directions: Down the hall, exit the cafe and go down the hall. Signs show where they are located. Also one in the basement if the one on the main floor is occupied.

name: University of Wisconsin-Waukesha
directions: Southview 009 & 011. Bathrooms are marked with unisex bathroom signs. Across from the faculty offices on the middle level of the building.

comment: All other washrooms so far located are traditionally-gendered, multi-stall, locking cubicles.
name: Milton S. Hershey Medical Center
directions: Two gender-neutral, single-occupancy \"family\"-style washrooms in the corridor next to the main cafeteria (Rotunda).

comment: very large newer well kept
name: Pronto Pizzeria
directions: behind dining area to the right

comment: Sign on bathroom says it\'s for customers only but in the past I\'ve gone in and noone\'s bothered me.
name: Johnson\'s Garden Center
directions: In the back of the main building.

name: Caribou Cafe
directions: Towards the back, sign says \"toilettes\"

comment: May be able to use the bathroom without buying anything if you just ask. The store is never too busy.
name: smoothie king
directions: Back of the store

name: Twist Yogurt
directions: In the back.

comment: Probably nobody will care if you use it without buying anything.
name: Princeton University Store
directions: Back of the store.

comment: A wonderful, very LGBTQ-friendly place.
name: Kirjakahvila
directions: If the place is open, you will see a sign at Vanha suurtori (\"the old marketplace\" so it\'s an open area) or at Hmeenkatu (road). If you go the Hmeenkatu route, turn first left and then right (the only way to go there) and then right again, and you\'ll be right at the door.

comment: Open 24 hours to hotel guests only. Must use a room key to access, but is a gender-neutral restroom with a locking door.
name: Embassy Suites
directions: Inside the fitness center near the pool entrance.

comment: very clean :-)
name: Blue Moon Evolution
directions: 2 on ground floor- one handicap accessable, other not.

comment: Possibly 21+, card at door on the night of shows, otherwise you should be good to go.
name: Basement Bar - Tycoons
directions: Walk to very back, there will be gendered bathrooms on the right, there is an elevator on your left, take elevator to -1, and there are non-gendered bathrooms to the left.

name: Police Department- ASUPD- Arizona State University
directions: Only available during business hours. After entering the main lobby, go to your left. Should arrive at hall with restrooms to your right, and elevators to your left.

name: Business Administration A Building- BA- Arizona State University
directions: Take the elevators to the second floor. Go right down hallway. Should be on right.

name: Business Administration C Building- BAC- Arizona State University
directions: Use doors nearest Starbucks to enter building. Restrooms should be on right; elevators should be on left.

name: College of Design North- CDN - Arizona State University
street: Design North 810 S. Forest Mall. Tempe, AZ 85287
directions: Enter from south entrance. Turn left to take stairs to the second floor. Restrooms should be on left, very near by.

name: Center for Family Studies- CFS- Arizona State University
directions: Should be easier to access from graduate student entrance doors. A majority of the building seems to be gated, around a large playground. Graduate student entrance doors are on west side of building. Anyway, enter there. Take stairs up. Should be two gender neutral restrooms.

name: Campus Children\'s Center- CHILD- Arizona State University
directions: Must have business there in order to use their restrooms. There are two, if you go down the hallway to your right.

name: Chuparosa Hall- CHUPA - Arizona State University
directions: Chuparosa also goes by the name building D of Hassayampa. Come from the east, to access room D101, the lobby. Restroom is located a little bit in, and to the right, from lobby entrance. Only open during lobby hours. Seemed a little bit restrictive.

name: Lattie F. Coor Hall- COOR- Arizona State University
directions: One on every floor. On first floor, located between main computing commons area (north) and gender specific (womens) restrooms (south, and along a west wall). If taking elevator up to other floors, go toward main building entrance doors, and they should be on your left, on the west side. Highly recommended due to the fact that there are many, and if one is full, just take an elevator up to get to another. However, the first floor one is not recommended so much. Sometimes the lock does not work, but usually when that happens there is a sign that says so. In any case, double check if youd like.

name: Cowden Family Resources- COWDN- Arizona State University
directions: When coming from west entrance doors, go straight down hallway. Look to right. However, when taking more main front entrance doors from east side, at first fork turn right. At next fork, left. Look to left for restroom.

name: Engineering Center G Wing- ECG - Arizona State University
directions: Located on third floor of building, directly behind elevators.

name: Payne Hall- EDB- Arizona State University
directions: Use Payne Hall East, not Payne Hall West. Might be better to enter Payne Hall East through the outdoors corridor that links buildings ED and EDB together, because restrooms are nearer to that entrance, instead of the east entrance. Anyway, take stairs to basement. Gender neutral restroom should be near gender specific (womens) restroom. A second gender neutral restroom is currently being built in Payne West.

name: Nelson Fine Art Center - FAC- Arizona State University
directions: Enter from east entrance that is slightly underground; you will need to take slight stairs to get here. You will arrive on the L floor. Follow hallway a little bit in. Gender neutral restroom should be right next to gender specific (womens) restroom; both are sort of tucked in a pocket in the wall. Building is very rounded and dark, and kind of secluded.

name: Gammage Auditorium- GGMA- Arizona State University
directions: Enter through main entrance. Turn left. Go through doors. Go a little bit down a hallway. On left should be restroom. Unsure if this restroom is open to the public; only ever been personally used during a show to Gammage.

name: Health Service Building- HSB- Arizona State University
directions: Enter through main entrance, located on south side of building. Pass reception desk, by turning left. Turn right. Continue down hall until there is a major hall on left. Turn there. Take hall, and when available turn left, where gender neutral restroom should be. There is at least one other gender neutral restroom, but staff mentioned it was for patients, so check in is likely needed for that one, and is likely deeper/more secluded in the building.

name: Interdisciplinary A- INTDS A - Arizona State University
directions: When entering from east, keep going straight (west). Turn right. Go to end of hallway. On left should be a corner full of restrooms. Gender neutral bathroom is left-most in the corner of restrooms. Recommended, if seclusion is desired, due to lack of traffic through building.

name: Interdisciplinary Science and Technology Building I - ISTB 1- Arizona State University
directions: Enter from south-east corner of building. Gender neutral restroom should be just behind main lobby desk, on right side. Possibly requires Sun Card, since it is behind a lobby desk.

name: Interdisciplinary Sciences and Technology Building V- ISTB 5- Arizona State University
directions: Enter from west side of building. Continue down a hall, keeping along the right as much as possible. Turn right. Gender neutral restroom should be near a water fountain. A little bit hard to access, as it seems very tucked into the building.

name: Juniper Hall Barrett Campus- JNHAL- Arizona State University
directions: There are two. One is on the southmost corner of the building, near the fence that leads to Rural Road. To access the other, take the stairs that are located between JNHAL and RWHAL to the second floor. After exiting the elevator, turn right. There should be a fork; on the left, is a glass door. Dont take the glass door because it requires a Sun Card. Turn right, and go down hall to outdoors area. Gender neutral restroom should be on your left side. Because Juniper is in Barrett, access may be more restricted to it, during evening/night hours, as the building becomes locked to those without Barrett residential Sun Cards. If this happens, try to wait for someone to leave Barrett and follow in after them; residents come/go often.

name: Ross Blakley Law Library- LAWLB- Arizona State University
directions: In the center of the building, a gender neutral restroom is currently being built. The building is sort of rounded.

name: G. Homer Durham Language and Literature- LL- Arizona State University
directions: When entering from west entrance, go straight. At first major fork, turn left. Down the hall, the gender neutral restrooms should be to your right. There should be two. They are kind of not recommended, if you prefer privacy. They have very sunny, bright windows that give the illusion of lack of privacy. The LL also has a north entrance and east entrance.

name: Latter Day Saints Institute- LDS- Arizona State University
directions: When entering from north entrance, look to left. Should be very near entrance. Unfortunately only available to Latter Day Saints Institute faculty. When entering from south entrance, continue straight, passing the front desk area, and making it to approximately the north entrance doors, where you would look to the right and see the gender neutral restrooms.

name: Life Sciences Building- LSA- Arizona State University
directions: When entering from west side entrance, should be to your right, very near the entrance. Not recommended, because the lock currently does not work and the door stays open for a very long timeâit swings all the way open and refuses to swing back closed until like five whole seconds have passed, so temporary lack of privacy may pose an issue for some. Building may also be accessed from the north side and east side.

name: Life Sciences Building- LSE- Arizona State University
directions: Building may be accessed from the north-east or south-east. Gender neutral restroom is located between gender specific (womensnorth) and gender specific (menssouth) restrooms. Recommended, but not. Restroom is generally good to use; however, sometimes it lacks privacy, as students often congregate outside of it, while waiting for Life Science building classes to begin. This building also has gender neutral restrooms on its S and B floors, on the south-most side. (There are three sets of doors to choose fromchoose the south-most one every time.) Those restrooms are also good, but again, sometimes lack privacy, especially when lab times have heavy traffic, as students will wait outside of them.

name: McClintock Hall- MCL- Arizona State University
directions: Only available to McClintock residents. When entering from main entrance (on east side), pass check in desk. Exit doors, and go into courtyard-like area. Enter a building on your immediate left (should be right across from Gammage Hall). Its like a microwave/rec area. Gender neutral restrooms should be on left, in that building.

name: Memorial Union- MU- Arizona State University
directions: Located on raised stair platform area across from Einsteins Bagels, nearest to north entrance doors. Located behind Freshens Frozen Yogurt. Recommended because the MU has a large block of business hours.

name: Murdock Hall- MUR- Arizona State University
directions: Located in room 108T1 on landing between basement and first floor. Lock does not work.

name: Noble Science Library- NOBLE- Arizona State University
directions: Enter building from north side. Keep going straight, as if you were going to the elevators. Just before the elevators, turn right. Gender neutral restroom should be on your right, between door and water fountains. Recommended.

name: Off Campus Student Services- OCSS- Arizona State University
directions: Enter building from north-west side. Must show Sun Card to check in desk. Once checked in, turn right. Should be in a student rec area. Turn left and go slightly down hall. Gender neutral restroom should be on your right. Recommended, but not. Its kind of hard to get to the OCSS because it is located somewhat off-campus and you must cross two roads (if coming from the west). Recommended, though, because OCSS often gives things out for free and allows ten pages of printing for free, per day, per student.

name: San Pablo Hall- PABLO- Arizona State University
directions: Requires Sun Card. Pass the front desk. Go around corner. Has two entrances.

name: Physical Education East- PEBE- Arizona State University
directions: Building may be entered from either the north side or south side. When entering from north side, turn left, once immediately able. Continue down hallway, and pass couch chairs, to just about the end, where gender neutral restroom is.

name: Physical Sciences Center- PSC- Arizona State University
directions: Located in the main hall that connects Physical Sciences A, B, C, and D together, but gender neutral restroom is specifically located between halls C and D.

name: Physical Sciences Center- PSF- Arizona State University
directions: Building may be entered from north side or south side. Entering from south side brings you closer to it sooner. When entering from south side, immediately look to right. When entering from north side, continue straight down hall; restroom should be to left.

name: Psychology Building- PSY- Arizona State University
directions: Use the entrance near room 102, on west side of building. Go straight down hall. Gender neutral restroom should be fairly close, on right side.

name: Palo Verde East- PVE- Arizona State University
directions: There are two in the lobby. Note that Palo Verde East are dorms, and access may be more restricted to non-residents.

name: Piper Writer\'s House- PWH- Arizona State University
directions: Enter building from south side. Take stairs that are immediately in front of you. Gender neutral restroom should be slightly to the right, at the top of the stairs. Unsure if recommended or not. Seems like you need permission to be in the building, and it is currently under construction/repairs.

name: John W. Schwada Building- SCOB- Arizona State University
directions: Enter from west side of building. Its a slightly confusing building, to us. Anyway, when you take this entrance, you should have taken a ramp to get there, so you end up on the second floor. Turn right, once meeting first major fork. Continue slightly down hall, looking to right, where gender neutral restroom should be.

name: School of Human Evolution and Social Change- SHESC- Arizona State University
directions: On third floor, on northeast corner of building.

name: Urban Systems Engineering- USE- Arizona State University
directions: Fastest if you enter from the east side. Restroom should be against the wall of the entrance, on your right. Also accessible from the west side. In an outdoors-classroom sort of square, against a background of yellow-and-black stripes.

name: Wells Fargo Arena- WFA- Arizona State University
directions: Very near section #3, on first floor. (Sections are labeled 1-16.) Section 3 is fairly near west side, but also a little near south side.

name: Wrigley Hall- WGHL- Arizona State University
directions: Accessible through room 111. Requires a Sun Card for entrance; student must be enrolled in classes to access. Sometimes, the Sun Card scanner does not work. Also available: gender neutral shower stall.

name: Women\'s Gymnastics Training Facility- WGTF- Arizona State University
directions: Must be a gymnast or spectator to use. Enter main entrance. Turn left through lobby for access. Called, to get information on this one. Phone-answerer seemed mean about giving out information on this restroom.

name: West Hall- WHALL- Arizona State University
directions: Inside of north wing of building, next to a gender specific (mens) restroom.

name: Wilson Hall- WILSN- Arizona State University
directions: Located inside of School of Justice and Social Inquiry, down main corner, next to a gender specific (womens) restroom.

comment: Just north of Knight St. and Jadwin Ave. intersection.  safe2pee map mistakenly places this farther north than it should me.
name: John Dam Plaza
directions: 3 single-occupancy restrooms in the small building on the western half of the park: men, women, and family/accessible.

name: Second Avenue Deli
directions: On the southeast corner of 75th street.

comment: The bathrooms are labeled \"robots\" and \"aliens\" but are gender neutral.
name: Saturn Cafe
directions: Back towards your left.  Keys are hanging on spatulas under the counter.

name: Diesel Cafe
directions: Two genderfree bathrooms on the left, about halfway back

name: Starbucks
directions: Locking male/female bathrooms in a little hallway on the left.

name: Clover
directions: Turn left under the stairs (you\'ll see them from the entrance). Two single-stall gender-free bathrooms are located down that hallway.

name: Forbes Library
directions:
Single-stall gender-neutral bathroom is on mezzanine level (use elevator to M - the stairs only go up to the 2nd floor). 
The bathrooms on 2nd floor, which are in the stacks area of the arts and music department, are gendered but single stall/locking.

name: Smith College, Neilson Library
directions: After entering the library, walk past the circulation desk and staircase and make a right (you\\\'ll be in the reference section). The single stall, accessible, gender-neutral bathroom will be on your right, just past the door to the stairs.

comment: According to the owners, the bathrooms are not officially gendered, but are rather marked with photos that could be construed as gendered in order to appease some people who apparently complained about the un-gendered bathrooms. In any case, they are single-stalled and locking.
name: The Tin Angel

comment: \"Family Restrooms,\" technically, but single-stall and gender-neutral.
name: Terminal 5/6 - JFK Airport
directions: One in the Jet Blue area near gates 4, 5 and 6 (across from a bar and a news stand), another in the hallway on the way from the arrival gates to the checked baggage pickup area.

comment: Open Monday thru Thursday from 9-6pm and on Fridays for those in need from 10-2
name: Wellness AIDS Services, Inc
directions: Entry is in the back on 4th street.  it is an HIV testing site so you can get free condoms and a test while you are there.  Bathroom is locking and is a one at a time gender neutral bathroom. A very TRANS friendly location.

name: NAU SBS Suite 100
directions: SBS on South Campus of Northern Arizona University. Also a side note, the third floor of SBS has trans friendly restrooms.

comment: amazing cupcakes at this place as well as affordable lunches&theyve just started selling smores coffee!? lots of vegan choices as well-cute girl employee alert!
name: Mad Cafe
directions: main floor back of cafe

comment: Hours: http://www.campusrec.colostate.edu/facilityinformation.cfm
name: Colorado State University Rec Center
directions: The lobby area is an open space (no fee) and has a gender inclusive single stall restroom.  For members, there are also gender inclusive locker rooms past the turnstiles.

comment: Building is limited to students/faculty/staff after a certain time, but access is not physically restricted.
name: University of Texas at Austin - Battle Hall
directions: 1st floor in the north hallway.

name: Alcuin Library, SJU

comment: The library also houses a library for the blind, so a goal was to exceed ADA requirements, including having a restroom for someone who needs a caregiver to assist.
name: Bayside Public Library

name: Red Mango

name: Leo R. Dowling International Center

name: Admissions Office
directions: Several located in the building. Two single stall gendered bathrooms (one male, one female) are on the first floor right behind reception desk. These two are accessible. A genderfree, accessible bathroom is located in the basement (take the elevator, turn right and keep going, the bathroom will be on your right.) A couple more really hidden ones as well.

name: Virgil T. DeVault Alumni Center
directions: First floor in the back of the building (far south) across from room 170. Turn right from the entrance and walk through the lounge. Turn left into the doorway right at the end of the lounge and walk past the elevator and up the stairs. There are also others at either end of the upper floors, where the administrative offices are.

name: Runcible Spoon
directions: near the back door

name: Student Recreation Sports Center
directions: Several in the building: Level 1, bathroom near entrance parallel to 10th st. Upper level: between the workout equipment and the room for SRSC classes.

directions: On each floor.

directions: ground floor

name: Hershey Hall (Ashton Center)

directions: 2 single occupancy locked gendered bathrooms on 3rd (ground) floor, 2 gender neutral children\'s bathrooms singled occupancy locked in children\'s room. comment:
I\'m not qualified to say whether the bathrooms are definitely accessible or not, but for folks who need to pee and have some mobility issues that make stairs difficult, you can also access the upstairs via the ramp that connects to the porch on the back side of the bar.

Also, I didn\'t notice that they checked ID during the day, but they do at night! You will probably need to be at least 21 (definitely at least 18) to get in.

The upstairs is open from 5p-midnight Thursday through Saturday, and from 5-11p on Sunday, though they just opened and the website says these hours may be subject to change. 

General hours: they\'re closed Mondays, open noon-11p on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Sundays, and open noon-midnight on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays.
name: Ore Dock Brewing Company
directions: There are two parts of the Ore Dock, a downstairs (open during the day) and an upstairs (open during the evening). I didn\'t scout out the downstairs to see if there were bathrooms, but upstairs, there is a marked gender-neutral bathroom near the marked gender-specific bathrooms. The bathrooms are on the side of the bar island nearest the lake.

comment:
The building is generally open during school hours (between 8a and 9p on weekdays, during the school year) for sure, I can\'t speak for other times. 

Pretty much as long as somebody figures you\'re a student and/or staff member, or a member of the community who has come to see a show at the Black Box theatre (whether you are or not) you should be just fine.
name: NMU Thomas Fine Arts building
directions: There\'s a long hallway on the first floor (not the tower part, the long bit near Jamrich), which is lined with lockers and classrooms. There are also several bathrooms there. Some are gendered multiple bathrooms, but about halfway down the hall there\'s a marked unisex, single-user bathroom.

comment: I\'m not sure if it is entirely ADA-accessible, although I remember it being large. I think there are two and both are genderfree, single-stall locking bathrooms. The staff was friendly on the day I visited, and if you like frozen yogurt, theirs is good.

Then go buy some coffee because it\'s the best in Lexington.

comment: Open when the university is open.  Also in this building are the LGBTQ center, parts of the music program, and the remnants of the UT honors program.  It\'s a pretty relaxed setting.
name: Melrose Hall
directions: Melrose is next to Hodges Library, the central library.  Enter the courtyard, (if you need a ramp, this will be on the side towards Fort Sanders), and then enter the building through the door to the right of the swing.  The bathroom is straight ahead.

comment: Open whenever the university is open.  Make sure to knock before opening the door, and make sure to lock while you are inside, as is common courtesy!
name: Austin Peay Building
street: Austin Peay Building, University of Tennessee
directions: The Austin Peay, or psychology, building is located on the side of \"The Hill\" on the UTK campus towards the University Center, soon to be the Student Union.  There are single stall, dual gendered, lock bathrooms on almost every floor.  On the first floor, just enter towards Ayers Hall, and look immediately towards the right.  Other bathrooms on higher floors are in other locations.

They have a \"public outhouse,\" in the old style.  Literally an old-timey outhouse.  It is up near the green-roofed log barn, towards the creek.

name: Morrill Hall

name: McCarthy Hall, Georgetown University
directions: Third floor, Justice and Diversity in Action Living and Learning Community. There are four multi-stall bathrooms (with showers) on the floor; usually two are women\'s, one is men\'s, and one is gender neutral. The specific designations for each bathroom change each academic year. Ask a student who lives on the floor, or look at the signage. The one missing a gendered sign is the gender-neutral bathroom.

comment: Awesome queer & transfriendly establishment!
name: The Pinhook

name: DePaul University Ray Meyer Fitness Center
directions: Head down the hallway to the left as soon as you walk through the door (that would be as you\'re facing the check-in desk). The bathroom is on the right. It is a locking/one-stall bathroom, but the sign specifically says unisex.

comment: 10am-5pm, Monday to Friday, as standard, ad hoc evening and weekend events.
name: LimeWharf
directions: In the main warehouse, ground floor, 4 toilets, 2 disabled, 2 unisex

name: Dickinson College
directions: Anywhere on campus and in the dorms

comment: Open 7 days/week, excluding holidays.

directions: 1st Floor in the vending machine lounge
In the back of the store

name: New York Public Library
directions: Second Floor

name: Jewel Grocery
directions: Past cash registers in front of store

comment: Super friendly library! They are open 11a-8p Monday through Thursday, and 11a-5p Friday and Saturday.
name: Burlington Public Library
directions: There\'s a family bathroom right near the children\'s section.  It\'s inside the main doors and to the left.

comment: The people at the coffee shop were really nice!
name: Silver Cup Coffee
directions: You have to ask for the key at the coffee shop, and then wade through people in business suits to get to the bathroom on the first floor, just past the mail room.

comment: Thrift store hours 10-5
name: Calico Cat
directions: Directly to the back left as you walk in the door.

comment: The employees at this location have been spoken to about allowing anyone who comes in to use whichever bathroom they want to.
name: Pita Pit
directions: On the main floor, past the counter

comment: Clean and quiet, but tucked away and difficult to find. A student union building, but welcoming to anyone. Open during term time until late.
name: AUSA Student Union Building
directions: On the first floor. Go past reception, up two flights of stairs and take the corridor to the right.

comment: 2 individual non-gendered toilets on each floor by the lifts, as well as an accessible toilet at either side of the building. Usually open until at least 8pm.
name: Aberdeen University Library
directions: Big glass building at the end of a paved piazza. Toilets are to the right of the building, before security desks, and on every floor above.

comment: Usually open until 4. Very friendly. Free. http://www.abdn.ac.uk/museums/exhibitions/kings-museum.php
name: King\'s Museum
directions: Small museum, easy to find at the back. Also has baby changing facilities.

comment:
Extremely Nice!            Mon-Fri: 8:00am-8:00pm
Sat:8:00am-6:00pm 
Sun:9:00am-6:00pm
name: Downtown Ace Hardware
directions: along back wall next to the exit and past the registers.

name: Northeastern University: West Village H
directions: Second and third floor has genderfree single-stall locking bathrooms.

name: Pavement Coffee
directions: When you walk in, it\'s on the right, opposite the register/coffee counter.

name: Jamba Juice
directions: Single-toilet restroom available for customers.  Should be obvious when you enter; just look to your left!

name: Trader Joe\'s
directions: Two single-toilet, gender-neutral restrooms are available on the left (north) side of the store, next to the wine section.

comment: This is a regular Subway chain restaurant. Just walk in quickly.
name: Subway

comment: Unisex restroom. Two stalls. Privacy lock with \"occupied\"/\"vacant\" indicator
name: Univ of Minnesota - Smith Hall
directions: Basement level. Enter lobby elevator. Go down one floor to \"B\" and turn to the right around the corner.

comment: This place itself is amazing in general- I\'d advise you stick around and hang out too. It\'s gamer heaven and the staff are epic :P (open 12pm to midnight)
name: Madd
directions: Past the bar area and to your left.

comment: Clean, has music, and on the down-low so not that many people know of it.
name: Memorial Student Center
directions: Second floor across from the ballroom (room 2300). Hidden between the men\'s and women\'s bathrooms.

comment: Very spacious and has a window if you open the blinds.
name: G. Rollie White Colosseum
directions: On second floor where the offices are close to the stairs that is closest to the Zone side of the building.

name: Krispy Kreme
directions: To the right of the counter in the hall

comment: Hours 11am-10pm every day
name: Five Guys
directions: In the hall to the left of the counter

comment: At North Hills.
name: Ben & Jerry\'s

comment: They are unisex bathrooms that are very very roomy.
name: Cain Hall
directions: Second and third floor in the C wing in the middle of the hallway.

comment: there are two, but i don\'t BELIEVE they\'re gender identified and they\'re large single stall bathrooms. i remember feeling very comfortable with them which is usually a sign that they\'re not traditional gendered bathrooms, anyway. You should probably buy something but I doubt anyone at Caribou would care.
name: Caribou Coffee
directions: next to the chalkboard straight back from the bar

comment:
Hours are:
Weekdays 9-8
Saturdays 9:30-6
Sundays 11-5
name: Party at Display and Costume
directions: On your right as you enter through the front doors

comment: Single stall. Locking. Accessible. Yes.
name: Colorado State University Behavioral Sciences Building
directions: Behavioral Sciences Building 1st floor. Located behind Coffee Shop with the male/female bathrooms

name: Galaxy Theater
directions: Left side, around the corner from the arcade.

comment: This is a LGBTQ bar. Very cool place and chill. At the time I went they had a men\'s, women\'s and a gender neutral handicapped accessible bathroom but the owner said he was in the process of making all the bathrooms gender neutral. All three bathrooms have locking doors.
name: The Broken Tusk

comment: This brewery\'s motto is \"All Are Welcome\", and they mean it. The bathrooms are not gender-free by accident. That was an intentional inclusion! The owners are friendly, the beer is amazing, and the bartenders are super cute. Say hi to Caroline!
name: The Kettle and Stone Brewing Company
directions: Left side of the hallway, two bathrooms.

comment: From what I gather they are a very liberal/open-minded staff. One of my favorite servers is openly gay.
name: Ravenous
directions: Back of restaurant on the left side

name: Saratoga Coffee Traders
directions: Back of store (past coffee counter and candy section) on the left.

comment: Open 24 hours
name: Price Chopper
directions: Enter the store and go to the right (towards produce). The restroom hallway entrance is in between the two \"Pick 6\" beer coolers. There are traditional gendered restrooms but then there is also a large \"family\" restroom which is genderfree. (and these restrooms are rarely occupied other than by employees, so no guilt if you don\'t actually have kids)

name: Mitchell Physics
street: Texas A&M University - Mitchell Physics Building
directions: Second-fifth floor of staff tower.

name: Rudder Auditorium
directions: Family restrooms next to the art.

name: Emerging Technologies Building
street: Texas A&M - Emerging Technologies Building - ETB
directions: First floor, next to the elevator and the other restrooms.

comment: open 8-5 most days.
name: Black Duck Coffee House
directions: at the back, on the left side of the room.

comment: Useful if you\'ve just gotten off the bus or train and don\'t want to use the gendered bathrooms in the train station.
name: Atlantic Superstore
directions: Once you go in, go past all the cashiers. Beside the last one there\'s a small aisle that leads to stairs & an elevator. The bathrooms are upstairs. Fully accessible.

comment: Open 9-7 most days. It\'s a small cafe so there\'s no way to sneak in without being noticed, but you might get away with asking.
name: Honey Bake Shop
directions: Down the hallway on the left side of the room.

comment: There are two of them, and they are separate!  They are there for anyone and sometimes people come in just to use the bathroom, but the employees will stand at the register anyway just in case you want something!  You do not have to buy anything, though.
name: McDonald\'s Restaurant
directions: Walk in the front door and it\'s at the other end of the restaurant directly in front of you, behind a partial wall.

comment:
OPENING HOURS : From 11 a.m. to AT LEAST midnight, on most days :D!!!! ---

I love it because it\\\'s a small restaurant and people are so busy with their own stuff, they don\\\'t do anything :) actually , it\\\'s the only public restroom I feel safe of using in my WHOLE TOWN lol :)
name: Bravo rotisserie pizzeria
directions: get in the restaurant. go straight. on right, single stalled, genderneutral bathroom. :)  rigt next to it : bigger bathroom for wheelchair accessibility.

name: Latitude 53
directions: First entrance on your right. Accessible bathroom second door on your right.

name: The Boathouse, Forest Park, St Louis
directions: Immediate right after the gate.

comment: TGRCNM is so much more than accessible, gender neutral bathrooms. It is a resource center dedicated to serving the transgender people of New Mexico and our families and loved ones. Come check out all our services and programs, or of course, just come by and use the restroom! The drop-in center is open Monday through Friday 1:00 - 6:00 p.m.
name: Transgender Resource Center of New Mexico
directions: There is a sign on the door that lets you know which one is TGRCNM.

comment: Very cool and queer/trans-friendly environment. Great food/drink too!
name: Haymarket Cafe
directions: One gender-neutral/accessible on first floor across from the counter, 2 gender-neutral on lower floor.

comment: One small single bathroom.
name: Prince Hookah
directions: To the right of the entrance

name: Subway
directions: Past the counter in the hall

comment: Open 24 hours, 2 gender neutral locking (1 accessible)
name: N1 Petrol Station
University of Michigan-Dearborn
directions: There are 4 on campus:  University Center, 2nd Floor; Administration Building near Human Resources; Computing Wing near ITS; Fairlane Center South near Dining Room D.

name: cafeteria (muddy cup)
directions: at the back past where you order food

comment: It\\\'s in a cinema, so probably you need to have ticket. There\\\'s are three bathrooms (male, female, transgender/other folk).
name: Cinema Muenster
directions: basement

comment: One of the nicest gender-neutral restrooms I\'ve ever seen in a park.
name: Tiles Park
directions: In the building behind the playground. Labeled \"family\" restroom.

name: Target
directions: Directly to the left of the front entrance, or straight ahead if you take the escalator up.

comment:
three gender neutral locking bathrooms, require waking up two steps to get to. Also has a shower.
Are meant for people camping there, but could probably use them if you asked.
name: wabigoon rv park
directions: on right side of office

comment: The library has recently added this genderless \"family bathroom\" in addition to the multi-stall gendered bathrooms.
name: Idaho Falls Public Library
directions: Through the parking lot entrance, past the reception desk, around the book return area and to the right.  (The person at the reception desk will gladly point it out to you if you ask)

comment: staffed by conservative old ladies
name: Life\'s a stitch
directions: bathroom on left of store

comment: Primarily for patients and their families. This clinic is very respectful, too.
name: Smiley\'s Family Medicine Clinic
directions: just off the lobby

comment: Single stall, simply labelled \"restroom\". Door locks securely. Hallway not especially busy but located near staff offices in a well-lit corridor. Not marked as ADA accessible. Signage directs people to the downstairs restrooms, though these are not marked as ADA accessible, and seem no more accessible than the single stalls.
name: Cristol Chemistry Building
directions: Second floor on the east wing of the building. Enter near the CHEM 140 entrance, take the stairs or the elevator upstairs.

comment: frequently occupied
name: Walmart
directions: in front of stores, past customer service and photo dept

comment: There is a bar behind the check-in desk (where you walk in), so coming in late-ish at night is probably fine! The lobby is pretty cool looking, and the bathrooms are huge for NYC standards.
name: Hudson Hotel
directions: Enter at street level at 356 W 58th St, take the escalator up to the lobby. From facing the lobby, turn left to see the elevators, walk towards them, then instead of getting in them, turn right down a hallway and take your first left, there are two genderfree restrooms.

comment: While you\'re there, check out the library\'s special collections!  They\'ve got a bunch of fabulous old gay stuff from on campus, like \"PROUD\", the gay newspaper on campus in the 1980s.
name: Wilson Library
directions: On the sixth floor, right outside Special Collections.

comment: There are 2 single occupancy bathrooms total, each is gendered, but the location of them in store (meaning most people will have no idea you just entered or exited the restroom)
name: Pottery Barn
directions: You need to ask an employee for a key, the bathrooms are on the lower floor of the store, the stairs are in the back of the store.

name: Safeway
directions: Right side of the store behind the deli.

comment: A nice place to grab a bite to eat if you\'re out cycling.
name: Rexville Market
La Conner Library
directions: In the back, near the childrens\' books.

comment: The fact that the restrooms are so far apart from each other makes them a bit risky, since going to the \"wrong\" one will be very obvious, but they\'re single-user and the owner is a real friendly guy. Also, try the Vanilla Cream Beer - you\'ll thank me.
name: Exit 6 Brewery
directions: \"Women\" to the left behind the bar, \"men\" to the right.

comment: It says \"bathroom for customers only,\" but this really isn\'t reinforced and you can easily access the two gender free bathrooms without keys.
name: Breaking New Grounds
directions: In to the back right of coffee shop.

comment: Open noon-6pm, Tues-Fri.
name: KRCC-FM
directions: Main floor, last door on the left.

comment: It is marked as handicapped accessible, but the only way to get there without using stairs is to go through Ford Hall, which is limited by performances much of the day. The location within the building is difficult to describe, sorry.
name: Simon Music Center
directions: It is between floors 2 & 3, by the Ford hall dressing room. If you come in the North-most staircase accessible on the east side of the building (the entrance near the north side of the fountain).

comment: There are several stalls, but the main bathroom door locks too. Very spacious!
name: Merrill Hall
directions: Second floor, SE part

comment: Store open M-Th 10 am-9 pm, Fri-Sat. 10 am-10 pm, Sun. 12-8 pm. Look for the giant inflatable black cat out front

comment: Porta-john accessible 24-7
name: East River Boat Ramp

comment: Accessible 24-7. Toll bridge on route ($1) if you approach from mainland side; no toll on route from island side
name: Radical Rides Parasail
directions: 2 accessible porta-johns in lot

comment: 2 porta-johns, 1 accessible.  Reachable 24-7. Toll bridge ($1) if approaching from mainland side; no toll on route approaching from island side
name: Fishing Pier Entrance at Grand Marlin
directions: At fishing pier entrance off parking lot for Grand Marlin restaurant

comment: Park hours technically 8 am-sunset, but not really enforced. WATCH FOR COPS - they\\\'re NOT kidding about 25 mph speed limit, esp. at night
name: UWF Wildlife Reserve
street: east of Allen R. Lewis Way
directions: Long beach park between Lewis Way and Gulf Islands National Seashore. East of Seashore Village on Google map. Parking lots C, D, E, and F each have 1 accessible port-john. Lot H has 2, 1 accessible

name: Ann Arbor Consultation Services
directions: Red brick building, park in the back (across the street from Kroger) Restroom is on the 2nd floor, along with gendered restrooms. This is a mental health clinic. People are likely to be friendly, but you should probably not make it too clear that you are ducking in for the bathroom without being a patient there.

comment:
Closed Mondays, Open daily between 12-8pm
(One of the owners is trans; feel free to say hi!)
name: Gaming Grounds
directions: Go through the door in the back and turn right down the hall. The bathroom is on the left at the end of the hall.

name: Interfaith
directions: 2 gender neutral single person bathrooms down on the lower floor; 2 gendered single person restrooms on upper floor

name: Refuge Cafe
directions: Near the back, labeled \"The Loo Gallery\"

name: In-House Cafe
directions: Back, to the right of the counter.

comment: Best Chinese place in Boston!
name: Shanghai Gate
directions: Way in the back, down the hall past the kitchen

name: Sunset Grill and Tap
directions: Turn right as you enter, past the main room, off a small hallway.

comment: Hard to spot so few people know there is a bathroom at this Starbucks at all. At times boxes of stuff are near door so not easy if wheelchair user.
name: AlbanyNY/Crossgates Mall/Starbucks
directions: In the Crossgates mall near the Best Buy store is a Starbucks...the is a gender free locking single stall bathroom by book case to the right inside store. Is tucked in.

name: The College of St. Scholastica
directions: The first set is in Tower Hall, on the first floor next to the One Stop office.  The second is in the science building on the second floor near the entrance to the tunnel towards Tower Hall.  The other ones are located in the new appartment buildings, Cedar, Scanlon, and Kerst.

comment: Somewhat fancy/normy bar, genderfree single-person restroom.
name: Capitol Cider
directions: First floor

comment: Three locking cubicles with a shared unisex space to wash your hands etc
name: Boston Tea Party
directions: At the top of the stairs

comment: Gendered restrooms, but with locks. Clean bathrooms and typically very friendly employees.
name: Casey\'s General Store

comment: There are also changing tables in this restroom (in addition to in all of the ladies\' rooms.)
name: Wal-Mart
directions: There is a \"family\" restroom at the back of the store that is gender neutral and large.

comment: I worked here for years.  The people are more than friendly and there\'s a gallery of art to see for free too!
name: The Art Center - Highland Park
directions: Two genderfree single, locking bathrooms on main floor.  Gendered bathrooms on lower level.

comment: 7am-10pm
name: Who Dat Coffee Cafe
directions: Its in the back past the counter, right before the ATM and the couches. You probably can use it without buying anything if you ask the barista.

comment: 10am-7pm
name: Byrdie\'s
directions: Its in the back on the right. You should probably check in with the person working the coffee area and ask them to use/where is the restroom.

comment: Available 24 hours
name: Sheetz
directions: Located inside of the building at the left rear corner.

name: Dartmouth College
street: Center for Gender & Student Engagement, 6 Choate Road

comment: The staff are incredibly friendly. It\'s closed on weekends.
name: Starbucks
Mercyhurst University
directions:
1st floor Old Main Building, around behind the desk worker
4th floor Old Main unmarked
3rd floor Old Main, near Fashion Department (multi-stall)
Mercy Heritage Hall/Sullivan
Preston Hall, bottom floor down from mailroom
Briggs, unmarked (x2)
Intelligence Building, 1st floor

comment: Open to the public 7:30am-10pm.  Open to GT students 24/7.
name: CULC
directions: Floor 2, towards the back.  There are two- both are unisex, both are handicap accessible, both have disposal for menstrual products.  The further back one has a baby changing table.

comment: 24/7. Automatic bathroom. Gross conditions, but genderfree and lockable.
name: Bentleigh
directions: If you\'re facing out of the library, look left - it\'s a smallish cubicle in the carpark.

PORTLAND LOOs are simple, sturdy,
flush toilet kiosks located on sidewalks
in public areas. The loos are free to the public and accessible every day of the year. Portland Loos give the
community environmentally-friendly,clean, and safe restroom facilities.
PORTLAND LOOs are open 24 hours a day,365 days a year
PORTLAND LOOs have handwashing stations mounted on the exterior to serve the pedestrian population PORTLAND LOOs are cleaned twice a day
PORTLAND LOOs are ADA-accessible and can fit a bicycle or stroller comfortably inside.
